We’re looking for a rockstar Social Media VA who is proactive, detail-oriented, and confident communicating in English. If you’re great at building relationships online, sending DMs, and sparking conversations — we want you!



This is NOT a posting role. This is NOT just content creation. This is a results-driven role focused on generating real leads through outreach and interaction.

Benefits include:

- 100% remote

- No work during the weekends

title: Shopify Shop / Operations Manager
description:
Salary Range: $800 – $1,400 USD/month (based on experience)

Hours: Full-time, 40 hrs/week (CET overlap required)

Type: Long-term, remote



About ULM:

We manage multiple Shopify stores for clients and internally. After stores are built and approved, they require continuous monitoring, optimization, product updates, and operational coordination.

We are hiring a Shop / Operations Manager to oversee multiple Shopify stores, manage changes, coordinate tea
mbers, and ensure smooth day-to-day operations.

This is a high-responsibility role.



What You Will Do:

- Oversee and manage multiple Shopify stores

- Coordinate product uploads, edits, and optimizations

- Monitor store health (policies, compliance, broken links, performance issues)

- Manage
 marketing flows (Klaviyo or similar)

- Coordinate with VAs and freelancers (hire when needed)

- Ensure product descriptions and images meet quality standards

- Monitor conversion rates and suggest improvements

- Implement pricing updates and promotions

- Work closely with Account Manager and CEO on priorities

- Track store performance and provide weekly reports



Requirements:

- 3+ years experience managing Shopify stores

- Strong operational mindset - organized and structured

- Experience with product management and store optimization

- Experience with
 marketing (Klaviyo preferred)

- Able to manage freelancers and VAs

- Strong understanding of e-commerce metrics (CVR, AOV, ROAS basics)

- Proactive problem solver - you identify issues before they escalate

- Excellent English communication

- Comfortable using Notion and Slack



Nice to Have (Not Required):

- Experience with Google Merchant Center

- Experience managing multiple stores simultaneously

- Experience scaling Shopify brands

- Basic knowledge of paid ads structure



What We Offer:

- $800–$1,400 USD/month based on experience

- Fully remote, long-term role

- High responsibility position with growth potential

- Direct communication with CEO

- Opportunity to build and manage a team under you

- 13th month pay and paid time off



How to Apply



Please include:

- A short paragraph explaining how you would manage 5 Shopify stores at the same time without missing important issues.

- One example of a store you helped improve and what metric you improved (conversion rate, AOV, revenue, etc.).

- Include the word “OPSMODE” at the top of your application.



Applications without the keyword will not be considered.

We are building a high-performance outbound sales team that books qualified meetings with decision-makers across the U.S.



The Role:

This is NOT a call center/Customer Support role.



We are hiring experienced B2B SaaS SDRs who have consistently booked meetings in the U.S. market and understand outbound sales at a strategic level.

title: AI-Powered Customer Success & Retention Lead
description:
Website: 



The Mission



You are the frontline of the Beauty Sleep Club. Your goal is to provide "Customer Service with Life"—bringing personality, empathy, and speed to every interaction. You will use AI to handle routine tasks so you can focus on high-level retention, managing our 3PL relationships, and turning unhappy customers into loyal fans.



Your Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

-Refund Rate: Maintain a refund rate below 2% by proactively offering solutions or exchanges.

-Chargeback Rate: Maintain a chargeback rate below 0.5% through rapid response and clear communication.

-Sentiment Score: Maintain 100% "clean"
/Instagram ad comments (hiding spam, answering questions, and engaging fans).

-Retention/Upsell: Drive trackable revenue by upselling customers in the chat (e.g., "Since you love the mouth tape, would you like to add the travel tin for 20% off?").

-Response Time: Average first-response time of under 2 hours during business hours.



Core Responsibilities

-Ad Engagement: Monitor and manage all comments on our
 and Instagram ads. You are the "hype person" and the "problem solver" in the comments section.

-AI Integration: Use AI agents (Zendesk AI, Gorgias, or ChatGPT) to automate common queries while maintaining a warm, human tone for complex issues.

-Retention & Upselling: Proactively suggest the "Sleep Club" subscription to one-time buyers and offer upsells during support interactions.

-Dispute Mitigation: Intervene immediately to reduce refunds and chargebacks by offering store credit, replacements, or personalized "how-to" advice.

-3PL Logistics Liaison: Communicate directly with ROBO3PL regarding missing orders, shipping delays, or tracking concerns to provide instant answers to customers.

-Feedback Loop: Provide a weekly "Voice of the Customer" report to the team, highlighting common complaints, product praise, or creative ideas for ads.



Who You Are

-High Energy: You have a "bubbly" and professional personality that shines through text.

-Problem Solver: You don't just "follow a script"; you find creative ways to keep a customer happy while protecting the company's profit.

-AI-Savvy: You know how to use AI to work faster and smarter, not just as a shortcut.

title: Ecom Performance Video Editor | High-Growth | Long-Term
description:
## Role Overview



The purpose of the Video Editor role at Ivy Ecommerce is to transform creative briefs into high-performing video ads that drive conversions at scale.



This is not just a technical editing role.



Our Video Editors are an integral part of the marketing engine. Your job is to understand the psychology, messaging, and strategy behind each ad concept, and bring it to life through sharp editing, pacing, storytelling, and attention to detail.



As a Video Editor, you are responsible for the execution and final polish of our video ads. The success of our marketing team depends on your ability to:



- Understand each creative brief from a performance/direct-response marketing lens

- Assemble visuals, hooks, captions, and pacing in a way that maximizes conversions

- Enhance the core marketing message through smart creative decisions



You understand that small details can be the difference between an ad that gets scaled to millions in spend and one that dies after testing.



Your role is to work closely with our Creative Strategists, actively learn what makes ads win or lose, and help us consistently produce winning ads month over month across our brand portfolio.





### Primary Responsibilities



- Edit and deliver ~10 ad briefs per week

- Collaborate closely with Creative Strategists to ensure each ad concept is executed correctly

- Implement feedback from the creative team and performance data to improve iterations

- Learn and internalize our ad strategy frameworks to understand what makes creatives “win” or “lose”

- Analyze your own creatives to identify what’s working, what isn’t, and how to improve

- Upload and organize final assets into the correct folders and formats for each platform





## Qualifications



### Direct Experience



- 1+ year experience editing eCommerce / performance marketing ads

- Experience working within a team environment and understanding roles in a creative workflow





### Character Traits We Look For



- Extremely high attention to detail – you care about the small things because you know they matter

- Creative + marketing-minded – you’re not just an editor, you’re curious about why ads perform

- Strong visual communicator and storyteller

- High curiosity and a desire to continuously improve your creative and marketing skills

- Willingness to do the “boring but important” work consistently at a high standard

- Clear communicator who collaborates well with a team

- Time-efficient, but willing to put in extra effort when quality demands it

- Hungry, motivated, and growth-oriented – you want to get better, take on more responsibility, and level up your career

- to make sure you are still reading, type “BLUE” in your response title.

- Coachable and open to feedback

- Not a clock-in, clock-out mindset — you care about results and impact







### This Role Is NOT for You If:



- You only want to execute tasks without understanding the marketing behind them

- You’re not interested in learning performance marketing or creative strategy

- You dislike feedback or fast-paced environments

- You’re disorganized or unreliable

- You prefer working solo and don’t enjoy team collaboration

- You’re not motivated to grow your skills and career over time







### Growth & Upside



At Ivy Ecommerce, we invest in people who perform and show initiative. This role has real upside for those who take ownership:



- Opportunity to grow into a Creative Strategist / Creative Lead role over time

- Increased responsibility across multiple brands in our portfolio

- Performance-based bonuses tied to ad spend (no cap)

- Long-term growth path into higher-level marketing and creative leadership roles



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants to build a career in performance marketing, creative & be part of building cool ecom brands, not just edit videos.







## ???? How to Apply



To be considered, please reply with:



- A short overview of yourself

- Your CV / Resume with your past work experience

- Your eCommerce video editing portfolio

- Your
 address + WhatsApp number



Then answer the questions below in detail:



1. What about this role excites you most?

2. Why do you believe you’re a strong fit for this role?







Applications that do not follow these instructions or provide detailed answers will not be reviewed.

title: Video Editor
description:
We are looking for a reliable and creative Video Editor to support ongoing content creation and marketing videos. This role will focus mainly on short-form and marketing content, with opportunities to grow into more advanced video projects over time.



This is a full-time remote position with flexible or crossover hours. You do not need to follow strict U.S. working hours, but there will be set times for meetings.





Job duties and responsibilities:

 

      1. Edit video content for:

               - Organic social media (reels, short-form videos)

               - Marketing campaigns

               - Personal brand content

               - Client-facing promotional materials

        2. Produce engaging, high-quality edits at scale

        3. Follow written briefs and creative instructions accurately

        4. Implement revisions and feedback efficiently

        5. Organize video assets and maintain clean project files

        6. Communicate clearly regarding timelines, questions, and updates

        7. Collaborate with the creative team and adapt to different brand styles

        8. Gradually take on more complex and higher-end projects as skills allow



Qualifications

         - Proven experience as a Video Editor (portfolio or sample work required)

         - Strong working knowledge of Adobe Premiere (required)

         - Ability to edit short-form and marketing videos efficiently

         - Good understanding of basic video editing principles (cuts, pacing, audio, captions)

         - Strong English comprehension and communication skills

         - Ability to follow written instructions and creative briefs

         - Detail-oriented, organized, and reliable with deadlines

         - Open to feedback and willing to learn and improve

         - Able to work independently in a remote setup





Preferred / Nice to Have



            - Experience with DaVinci Resolve (especially for color grading)

            - Experience with Canva

            - Background in editing content for social media or digital marketing





If you believe you're a strong fit for this position, please respond with the following:



     1. A link to your resume in PDF format. 

          Your resume should include your contact details, a recent professional photo, and a summary of your work 

          experience, emphasizing tasks relevant to this role.



      2. A screenshot of your PC specifications and internet speed, 

      3.  Your WhatsApp number for easy communication. 



To ensure you've read this message carefully, please include the word "VIDEOEDITING" in the subject line of your
.



We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Senior Shopify Integrations Developer
description:
Position Overview

We are seeking multiple Senior Shopify Integrations Developers to build, optimize, and maintain complex commerce ecosystems. This isn't just about tweaking themes; you will be responsible for architecting deep integrations between Shopify Plus and enterprise systems (ERP, CRM, and Logistics). This is a fully remote, long-term full-time position.



Key Responsibilities

Custom Integration Development: Design and implement robust private and custom Shopify apps to extend platform functionality.



API Management: Architect and maintain seamless data flows between Shopify (REST/GraphQL) and third-party APIs.



Performance Optimization: Ensure high-speed checkout experiences and efficient backend processing for high-volume merchants.



System Architecture: Build middleware solutions to sync inventory, orders, and customer data across distributed systems.



Collaboration: Work closely with U.S.-based design and strategy teams to translate brand visions into functional technical requirements.



Code Quality: Lead code reviews, maintain detailed documentation, and ensure security best practices for handling sensitive customer data.



Required Qualifications

5+ years of professional web development experience, with at least 3 years focused heavily on the Shopify ecosystem.



Deep Shopify Expertise: Mastery of Liquid, Shopify Ajax API, and the Shopify Admin API (REST & GraphQL).



Backend Proficiency: Strong experience with Node.js, PHP (Laravel), or Ruby on Rails for app development.



Database Skills: Experience with SQL (PostgreSQL/MySQL) or NoSQL databases for managing external app data.



Modern Frontend: Proficiency in JavaScript (ES6+), React, and Polaris (Shopify’s design system).



Version Control: Expert-level knowledge of Git and collaborative workflows (GitHub/Bitbucket).



Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Shopify Plus features (Flow, Launchpad, Scripts).



Familiarity with Headless Commerce architectures (Hydrogen/Oxygen).



Experience with AWS or Google Cloud Platform for hosting custom middleware.



Knowledge of automation tools like Zapier or Make for quick-turn integrations.



Why Join Us?

Competitive Salary: $7–$11/hour (negotiable based on senior-level experience).



Stability: Long-term, 40-hour-per-week consistent work with premium U.S. clients.



Culture: Work with a team that values your architectural input and professional growth.



Hassle-Free: We handle the administrative details (taxes, benefits, and payroll) so you can focus on writing great code.



Skill Requirements

Shopify



GraphQL



Node.js / PHP



Liquid



API Integration

title: Virtual Receptionist VA (Remote) | Fast Hiring – 24-Hour Review
description:
Important: Our application process moves quickly. If you are selected to proceed to the next interview stages, you must be able to respond promptly. Candidates who do not respond in a timely manner may be passed over.



We are currently seeking a Remote Spa Receptionist to manage inbound calls and book spa appointments. This is a long-term, performance-based position. Calls are recorded and reviewed regularly. Continued placement in this role depends on accuracy, professionalism, booking success, reliable attendance, no missed calls during scheduled shifts, quick response times, and the ability to professionally manage complaints and de-escalate dissatisfied clients.



To apply: Please copy the questions below, paste them into your reply, and answer each question thoroughly.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected?



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed.



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute?



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome.



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional.



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job?



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired?



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available.



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.

title: Social Media & Reels Content VA (Real Estate – Australia Market)
description:
JOB TITLE



Social Media & Reels Content VA (Real Estate – Australia Market)



EXAMPLE REEL OF THE QUALITY I'M : 
==



ABOUT US



We are Monarch Buyers Agents, a fast-growing property advisory business based on the Gold Coast, Australia.



We help investors, first home buyers, upsizers and developers secure the right property — with strategy, data and strong negotiation.



We are building a strong social presence across:

 • Instagram

 •

 • TikTok

 • LinkedIn



Our content focuses on:

 • Auction insights

 • Property strategy

 • Market education

 • Development & subdivision opportunities

 • Gold Coast property trends



We are looking for a proactive, creative Social Media VA who can take ownership of our content scheduling, editing and ideation.



?



ROLE OVERVIEW



This is NOT just a scheduling role.



We are looking for someone who:

 • Understands social media trends

 • Knows how to structure viral-style reels

 • Can think strategically about content angles

 • Is proactive with ideas (not just waiting for instructions)



You will work closely with the business owner and help build our brand authority in the Gold Coast property market.



?



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

 1. Content Planning & Scheduling

 • Plan and schedule content 1 month in advance

 • Organise and manage a structured content calendar

 • Repurpose content across Instagram,
, TikTok & LinkedIn

 2. Reel Ideation

 • Analyse our existing reels

 • Create new reel ideas aligned with our style

 • Send weekly filming briefs outlining:

 • Hook

 • Talking points

 • Call to action

 • Suggested B-roll or overlays

 3. Video Editing

 • Edit high-quality reels including:

 • Green screen reels

 • Video overlays

 • Captions

 • Transitions

 • Music aligned with trends

 • On-screen graphics

 • Optimise formatting per platform

 4. Trend Monitoring

 • Stay updated with:

 • Current social media trends

 • Viral reel formats

 • Property-related content trends

 • Suggest relevant trend-based content for our market

 5. Proactive Strategy Input

 • Suggest new content angles

 • Identify gaps in our content

 • Help position us as authority figures in the Gold Coast property space



?



REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

 • Strong experience editing short-form video content

 • Experience with green screen reel editing

 • Proficiency in CapCut, Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or similar

 • Understanding of hooks and high-retention reel structures

 • Strong English communication

 • Organised and deadline-driven

 • Experience working with Australian, UK, or US businesses preferred

 • Real estate content experience highly regarded



?



IMPORTANT APPLICATION REQUIREMENT



To be considered, you MUST submit a short video.



Please send a video of yourself ON CAMERA answering the following:

 1. Why would you like to work at Monarch Buyers Agents?

 2. What are your strengths?

 3. What are your weaknesses?

 4. Why should we hire you?



Important:

 • The video must be a MAXIMUM of 3 minutes.

 • Videos longer than 3 minutes will not be considered.

 • Please speak clearly and professionally.



Applications without a video will not be reviewed.



?



WORKING HOURS

 • Part-time initially (20 hours per week)

 • Potential to move to full-time for the right candidate

 • Flexible hours, but must overlap at least 2–3 hours with Australian time



?



HOW TO APPLY



Please include:

 • Your portfolio (links required)

 • Examples of reels you have edited

 • The 3-minute video

 • Your monthly salary expectation (in PHP)



We are looking for someone long-term who wants to grow with our business.

title: Senior Account Manager
description:
Company Description



At STAAK Inc., we partner with organizations across various industries to create strategies that drive growth and deliver measurable results. With over two decades of experience, we specialize in combining digital marketing expertise with traditional techniques to create impactful campaigns and standout brands. Our integrated marketing services span social media, SEO, GEO, web development, design, print, and direct mail, ensuring a cohesive approach to achieving our clients’ goals. Our process is collaborative, data-driven, and grounded in trust, fostering strong partnerships that lead to lasting success.



Role Description



We’re looking for a senior-level Account Manager who can confidently lead client relationships across a wide range of marketing initiatives, including branding, creative, digital campaigns, web, and real-world execution like signage, wraps, print, and activations.





This is a high-trust role for someone who can manage day-to-day delivery while also contributing strategic recommendations that improve outcomes. You won’t be expected to simply “take orders.” We want someone who can add value respectfully, bring forward better options, and help elevate both client results and internal execution.





You’ll work closely with all functional groups at MDP, as well as external suppliers, ensuring projects move smoothly, timelines stay on track, and quality stays high.





Key Responsibilities



 

Serve as the primary day-to-day lead for assigned client accounts

Build strong, long-term client relationships through clear communication, leadership, and follow-through

Translate client objectives into clear briefs, priorities, and action plans for internal teams and suppliers

Lead client meetings, updates, and performance conversations with confidence and professionalism

Drive project execution across deliverables such as:

Branding and creative initiatives

Web and digital projects

Campaign planning and production coordination

Paid media coordination (working closely with internal specialists)

Physical/offline deliverables (signage, vehicle wraps, print, OOH, activations)

Coordinate internal teams and external suppliers to ensure work is delivered on time and on brand

Review work before client delivery to ensure it’s accurate, complete, and ready to present

Provide strategic recommendations that strengthen outcomes (messaging, tactics, priorities, timing, scope)

Proactively flag risks (scope creep, timelines, approvals, quality gaps) and bring forward solutions early

Support proposals, presentations, and pitch work by contributing strategic account thinking and recommendations

Maintain strong internal collaboration and a roll-up-your-sleeves mindset to keep work moving forward.





Qualifications



5+ years experience in account management, client services, or project leadership (agency experience preferred)

Strong understanding of marketing fundamentals across digital, creative, and brand execution

Confident leading client calls and handling pushback, feedback, and shifting priorities professionally

Proven ability to manage complex timelines and multiple stakeholders without losing control of details

Excellent written and spoken English communication skills

Highly organized, proactive, and solutions-oriented

Comfortable supporting North American clients and working across time zones

Team player mindset with a high level of accountability and maturity

mbers (design, copy, account team) to maintain quality and meet deadlines

title: Website Developer + SEO & Google Business Specialist
description:
Job Title: Website Developer + SEO & Google Business Specialist

Company: Allied Health Consulting (AHC)

Location: Remote (Offshore)

Engagement: Full-Time (Australian Business Hours)



GREAT BENEFITS AND PERKS! POTENTIAL SPONSORSHIP.



About Allied Health Consulting



Allied Health Consulting partners with dental and allied health clinics across Australia to build structured, scalable growth systems. We operate as the outsourced digital and analytics department for multiple clinics, focusing on long-term organic visibility, conversion optimisation, and predictable patient acquisition.

We prioritise systems, measurable outcomes, and continuous improvement.



Role Summary



Your responsibility is to build and optimise websites, execute suburb-based SEO strategies, manage Google Business Profiles, and improve website conversion pathways. This is an outcome-driven role focused on rankings, traffic growth, calls, bookings, and review performance. The role is growth based and will evolve as you evolve! 



Core Responsibilities



Website & Architecture



Maintain scalable multi-clinic websites

Build and optimise service, location, team, and FAQ pages

Ensure internal linking and navigation support SEO and user flow

Maintain accurate clinic information and booking pathways



Landing Pages & Conversion Optimisation



Build high-converting landing pages for priority services (e.g. emergency, Invisalign)

Improve CTAs, layout clarity, trust signals, and mobile UX

Align design with service urgency and user intent



Local SEO Execution



Manage on-page SEO: metadata, headers, schema basics

Conduct suburb-level competitor and gap analysis

Implement structured content updates to improve rankings

Maintain internal linking strategy across clinics



Google Business Profile Management



Optimise and monitor all clinic listings

Maintain NAP accuracy, categories, services, and media

Protect against duplicate listings or incorrect edits

Improve map-pack visibility and engagement



Blog & Content SEO



Build suburb + service-based content roadmap

Write or manage SEO-aligned content production

Use blogs to strengthen authority and internal linking



Technical SEO & Performance



Monitor speed, indexing health, crawl issues, and broken links

Maintain mobile-first usability

Ensure booking forms, click-to-call, and UX elements function consistently

Execute monthly technical health checks



Core Deliverables



Monthly SEO and website improvement plan (per clinic)

Fully optimised service and location pages

Campaign landing pages built and maintained

Google Business Profiles managed and tracked

Review system implemented with reporting

Monthly SEO performance report (traffic, rankings, conversions, issues)

Technical website health checklist completed monthly



Success Metrics



Improved local rankings (organic + map pack)

Growth in non-paid traffic per clinic

Increased call and booking conversion rates

Growth in Google Business interactions

Consistent review volume and rating stability

Improved site speed and reduced technical issues



Required Skills



Strong Local SEO experience (Australian market preferred)

WordPress proficiency (multi-site architecture experience preferred)

Conversion rate optimisation knowledge (healthcare experience advantageous)

Google Business Profile management expertise

On-page SEO and internal linking strategy

GA4 and Google Search Console familiarity

Basic schema and technical SEO diagnostics

Ability to write or manage SEO-driven content



Working Environment



Full-time commitment aligned with Australian business hours

Remote role with structured reporting

Regular alignment meetings with marketing and clinic leadership



Why Join Allied Health Consulting



We are building long-term systems, not short-term campaigns.

You will work under a fair, transparent, and supportive leadership structure that values systems thinking, autonomy, and accountability. Our culture prioritises innovation, integrity, collaboration, excellence, and empowerment.



Long-Term Benefits & Stability



Paid annual leave entitlements

13th month pay

Structured salary progression 

Year 3 loyalty benefit - Paid Holiday For Employee + 1 additional person.

Long Service Savings Arrangement commencing Year 4 = Employer + Employee co-contribution of $50 per week that will be a lump sum paid out at end of year 8.

Australian Sponsorship Pathway between Years 8–10, subject to performance and legal eligibility.



This is an outcome-based role with flexibility. Performance and results matter more than micromanagement.



Application Requirements



Submit:

CV and Cover Letter

 Cover Letter Questions:

A little about yourself and your background.

Why you are well suited for this role and position. 

Describe how you would build a scalable SEO and Website system for a dental clinic. 

Give a detailed example of a local SEO project where you were fully responsible for results. Include starting metrics, strategy implemented, obstacles faced, technical fixes applied, and measurable outcomes (rankings, traffic, calls, bookings, map-pack performance).

Explain how you approach conversion optimization for healthcare websites.

Describe a time when a website had performance or indexing issues 



Portfolio of work demonstrating websites you’ve created

Your 16personalities test results - personality type + percentages. 

Added bonus - do an analysis of either 
 and/or 
 and give a breakdown of your analysis and how it could be improved/optimised. 



Only applicants that submit above will be considered for this potentially life changing position!

title: AI Content Quality Controller and message Specialist I Human Checkpoint for AI-Powered Outreach | Remote
description:
About Handshake:

Handshake platform is a humanised, AI-powered outreach platform that builds genuine relationships while keeping the efficiency and scale modern businesses need.

It's not another cold outreach tool. This is AI that creates genuine human connections.

Handshake helps B2B companies book qualified meetings through psychologically optimised conversations. But here's the difference: our AI doesn't just blast templates. It builds relationships using multiple specialist AI systems that adapt to each conversation.

We're at an exciting stage: Our AI is good, but we want to keep an human expert to ensure it stays great. That's where you come in.

Check out our website: 



The Role: Your Mission as the Human Checkpoint

You're the final quality guardian before AI-generated messages reach real prospects.

Think of yourself as the bridge between AI precision and human authenticity. You'll review messages, approve what works brilliantly, refine what needs polish, and flag what misses the mark. Your insights help us understand where our AI excels and where it needs course correction.

This isn't just proofreading. You're protecting client reputations, ensuring every message feels genuinely human, and helping businesses book more meetings through conversations that build real relationships.

You'll work across multiple client accounts, each with their own voice, industry, and objectives. Some days you'll approve messages rapidly because the AI nailed it. Other days you'll catch subtle nuances that could make or break a conversation. Both are equally valuable.



What You'll Do Daily

Core Responsibilities:

1. Review and approve AI-generated outreach messages before they're sent

2. Edit content to perfectly match each client's brand voice and tone

3. Identify when messages need minor tweaks vs. complete rewrites

4. Maintain consistency across all client communications

5. Flag potential issues with messaging, cultural sensitivity, or appropriateness

6. Report patterns and opportunities for AI improvement to the account manager

7. Keep detailed quality logs and provide actionable feedback on AI performance

8. Balance speed with accuracy (we need quick turnarounds without compromising quality)



You're the Perfect Fit If You Have

Must-Haves:

Linguistic Excellence 

1. Exceptional English proficiency (native or near-native level)

2. Strong grasp of professional business writing styles

Sharp Eye for Detail

1. You catch inconsistencies, and tonal shifts that others miss

2. You notice when something is technically correct but doesn't feel quite right

3. You're bothered by small errors and driven to fix them

AI Literacy

1. Experience working with AI tools and understanding their strengths and limitations

2. You know AI is brilliant but imperfect, and you're curious about making it better

3. Comfortable learning new platforms quickly

Professional Background

1. Copy editing, proofreading, or content review experience preferred

2. Brand-conscious mindset with ability to adapt tone for different audiences

3. Understanding of how messaging impacts business outcomes



Proactive Ownership & Communication 

1. You don’t wait for instructions when you see a problem; you flag it and suggest a solution. 

2. You practice "high-signal" communication: keeping your team updated on progress without being asked. 

3. You are comfortable asking "Why?" and "How can we make this better?" rather than just following a checklist.



Skills That Set You Apart:

1. Cultural intelligence, previous experience working with Israeli customers and business leaders

2. Quick learner who grasps new industries and terminology rapidly

3. Strong time management handling multiple accounts simultaneously

4. Proactive communicator comfortable asking questions and raising concerns

5. Strategic thinker who understands the psychology behind effective messaging

6. Discretion with confidential client information



Nice to Have:

Marketing, communications | Sales outreach or LinkedIn messaging experience | Familiarity with brand style guides | Experience reviewing AI-generated content



What We Offer:

Professional Growth: Comprehensive training, direct collaboration with our team, regular feedback.

Flexibility: Fully remote work from anywhere with reliable internet, and flexible scheduling within APAC business hours. While the role offers flexibility, responsiveness is key. You need to be available to reply promptly when a lead or urgent client message comes in. 

Experience: Exposure to diverse B2B brands, learn what makes successful outreach work, understand psychological principles behind high-converting conversations

Compensation: Competitive part-time hourly rate with potential for increased hours



How to Apply:

We want to see how you think, not just what you've done. Please send us

1. Your CV

Highlight relevant experience with:

- Content review, editing, or proofreading

- AI tools or platforms

- Cross-cultural communication

- Remote work



2. We want to see how you think, spot details, and solve real problems you'll face in this role.



Part A: AI Detection Skills (
words)

What are 3-4 specific telltale signs that a professional business message was written by AI rather than a human?

Don't just say "it sounds robotic" be precise. 

What patterns do you notice? What phrases, structures, or quirks give it away? Think about rhythm, word choice, sentence structure, personality (or lack of it), and anything else that makes you think "hmm, that's not quite human."

We want to understand your eye for detail and how you evaluate content quality.



Part B: Language Nuance in Context 

You're reviewing an outreach message for Israeli C-level audience:

Analyze:

AI often writes long, "flowery" introductions like: "I hope this
 finds you well. I was recently looking at your profile and was truly impressed by your accomplishments..."

Why is the sentence above a "red flag" for a busy Israeli CEO? (1-2 sentences).



Rewrite: 

Take the AI-generated message below and rewrite it to be short, direct, and punchy for an Israeli prospect.

AI Message: "I am reaching out because I believe our AI-powered platform could potentially help your esteemed organization significantly enhance your lead generation efforts and streamline your workflow for better results. Would you be open to a brief 15-minute call sometime next week?"



Explain: 

What did you remove and why?





Application Details:

Send to: Angelina – Handshake Operations lead: 

Subject line: "AI Message Specialist - [Your Name]"

Response time: We review applications on a rolling basis and will respond within 5 business days.

Questions? Feel free to reach out before applying. We're happy to chat about the role, answer questions, or clarify anything that's unclear.



Why This Role Matters

Every message we send represents a client's brand and could be the start of a valuable business relationship. You're not just checking grammar, you're protecting reputations, building trust, and helping businesses grow.

In a world where AI is everywhere, the human touch has never been more valuable. If you're someone who cares about the details, understands the power of words, and wants to work at the intersection of AI and human connection, we'd love to hear from you.

Ready to be our human checkpoint? We're excited to meet you.

title: HR & Recruitment Manager (Recruitment & HR Operations)
description:
We are looking for an experienced HR & Recruitment Manager with a strong background as an HR Generalist to lead end-to-end recruitment while managing core HR functions. This role requires someone who can build strong talent pipelines, manage full-cycle hiring, and support overall HR operations including employee relations, performance management, training & development, compliance, and HR administration.



The ideal candidate is organized, proactive, and strategic, capable of improving HR processes, supporting leadership, and strengthening company culture while ensuring HR policies and procedures are properly implemented.





Responsibilities: 



Talent Acquisition & Recruitment Management

--Lead and oversee global recruitment operations, ensuring efficient coordination with HR/Admin teams and timely execution of hiring and HR processes.

--Lead end-to-end talent acquisition across Philippine and international markets, overseeing sourcing, screening, interviews, offer management, and pre-hire support for remote positions.

--Build and sustain strategic talent pipelines, utilizing advanced sourcing methods, market mapping, and salary benchmarking for niche and hard-to-fill positions.

--Align recruitment strategies with business objectives, partnering with department heads to implement structured, consistent, and data-driven hiring practices.

--Enhance employer branding and candidate experience, maintaining strong engagement, professional communication, and long-term pipeline relationships.

--Ensure recruitment compliance and operational excellence, maintaining ATS accuracy, tracking KPIs (time-to-fill, conversion rates, pipeline activity), and delivering performance reports to leadership.



Employee Relations

--Serve as point-person for employee concerns, conflict resolution, and workplace issues

--Handle employee investigations, mediation, and disciplinary processes fairly and consistently

--Coach managers on employee management best practices

--Ensure proper documentation and compliant handling of employee relations cases



Organizational Strategy

--Support organizational planning: workforce planning, structure development, role clarity, and manpower forecasting

--Create HR systems aligned with business goals and scaling needs

--Provide HR insights to leadership for decision-making and organization performance improvement



HR Compliance & Legal

--Ensure compliance with company policies and local labor regulations

--Prepare and maintain HR documentation: memos, i
 reports, disciplinary notices, and termination documents

--Update and improve HR policies, handbook, and SOPs as needed



HR Operations & Administration

--Maintain employee records and HR documentation (201 files, contracts, onboarding forms, etc.)

--Support HR reports and admin requirements (attendance monitoring, leave tracking, manpower reports)

--Coordinate with payroll/admin teams to ensure accurate employee data and timely processing

--Improve HRIS processes (employee data, tracking forms, onboarding templates, clearance records)

--Ensure HR documentation and payroll-related records are organized, secure, and updated



Engagement & Culture

--Lead or assist employee engagement programs and internal activities

--Support culture-building initiatives including recognition programs and communication strategies

--Implement initiatives that support retention, morale, and team alignment



HR Process Improvement

--Identify gaps and inefficiencies in recruitment and HR operations

--Develop and implement improved HR workflows, templates, and systems

--Create HR SOPs and tools for consistent execution across teams

--Track HR KPIs and recommend improvements based on data

--Use ClickUp to:

-Manage recruitment pipelines and task assignments

-Track HR operations, cases, and project timelines

-Implement HR dashboards, automation, templates, and checklists

-Monitor team deliverables and HR KPIs consistently

--Ensure HR processes are transparent, measurable, and consistently executed



Requirements: 

--Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Psychology, Business Administration, or related course

--5+ years of HR experience, with strong exposure as:

-Recruiter / Talent Acquisition

-HR Generalist handling core HR functions

--Proven ability to manage multiple hiring requirements while handling HR operations

--Strong knowledge of HR processes including:

-Recruitment & Selection

-Employee Relations

-Performance Management

-Training & Development

-HR Compliance

-HR Admin/Documentation

--Proficient in project management tools, preferably ClickUp for task tracking and collaboration.



Preferred Skills: 

--Experience managing an HR or recruitment team

--Experience handling company HR policies and documentation

--Exposure to HR reporting, HR tools, and HR systems

--Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office/Google Workspace

title: YOUTUBE THUMBNAIL CREATOR
description:
We are hiring a highly skilled and serious Thumbnail Designer to join our YouTube channel on a dedicated part-time retainer.

This is not a beginner role.



This position directly impacts our click-through rate (CTR), video performance, and overall channel growth. We are looking for someone who understands that thumbnails are packaging — and packaging drives revenue.



We currently have 262,000+ subscribers, generate approximately 3.4 million views per month, and are growing rapidly. We are expanding our team and looking for motivated, creative individuals who understand human psychology and visual persuasion.



You can review our channel here:

???? 

(Respectfully, if you're thumbnails are not as good as these, please do not apply)



We publish anywhere between 15–30 videos per month, depending on schedule, and require a consistent 24-hour turnaround on all thumbnail projects.

If your work cannot outperform our current thumbnails, this is not the right fit.



???? Responsibilities

• Create high-performing YouTube thumbnails for reaction and finance-based content

• Deliver thumbnails within 24 hours of receiving assets

• Provide 2–3 strong concepts when requested

• Make fast revisions when needed

• Study our current thumbnails and improve upon them

• Maintain organized, layered PSD files

• Collaborate as part of a team and follow direction carefully

• Be responsive and professional in communication



???? What We Are Looking For

• Advanced Adobe Photoshop skills (non-negotiable)

• Strong cutout skills, lighting adjustments, color grading, and compositing

• Deep understanding of YouTube thumbnail psychology

• Ability to create emotional intensity and strong visual hierarchy

• Understanding of what drives high CTR on YouTube

• Fast turnaround and ability to work under deadlines

• Reliable communication and team-oriented mindset

• Hungry, proactive, and growth-focused attitude



???? Compensation

Starting Pay: $600 USD per month

This includes:

• Up to 25 thumbnails per month

• 24-hour turnaround expectation

• 1–2 revision rounds per thumbnail

Additional thumbnails beyond 25 will be compensated separately.

This is a dedicated part-time retainer position. You will be expected to prioritize our projects when assigned.

Compensation increases are performance-based.

???? 60–90 Day Assessment Period

All new hires will begin with a 60–90 day assessment period. During this time, we will evaluate:

• Quality of thumbnail designs

• Consistency of turnaround time

• Ability to follow direction

• Communication and teamwork

• Initiative and creative improvement

• Overall packaging performance

At the end of this period, we will determine long-term fit and discuss potential growth opportunities based on performance.



???? Application Requirements (READ CAREFULLY)

To be considered, you MUST:

Include the word “CTR” in your application

Send 2–3 YouTube thumbnails you personally created

Briefly explain what makes a YouTube thumbnail high-performing

Confirm you are willing to complete a sample thumbnail design as part of the interview process (unpaid)

Confirm you are open to a video interview if shortlisted

Applications that do not follow instructions will not be considered.

???? Sample Thumbnail Test

Shortlisted candidates will be asked to complete a sample thumbnail design to evaluate skill level, creativity, ability to follow direction, and understanding of our channel style.



???? Important

• All designs created under this role are company property

• Must be comfortable signing a basic agreement

• Must maintain confidentiality

• Must not reuse designs for competitors in the same niche

We are building long-term.

We are serious about performance.

We are looking for someone who is talented, disciplined, understands human psychology, and is ready to grow with a fast-scaling YouTube channel.

If that’s you — apply.

title: Lead UI/UX Designer for Luxury for e-commerce platform

title: Real Estate Acquisitions (+Bonuses!)
description:
Real Estate Acquisitions Specialist (Remote)



About Us

Price Real Estate Investments is a multi-market U.S. based real estate investment company focused on acquiring off-market properties directly from homeowners. We specialize in building strong relationships with sellers, negotiating with them, and closing deals virtually. Our team is fully remote, but our impact is nationwide — and we’re growing quickly.



We’re looking for an experienced Real Estate Acquisitions Specialist to join our acquisitions team. This role is critical to our business: you’ll be speaking directly with homeowners, negotiating terms, and guiding sellers through the contract signing process. If you’ve personally made offers to sellers and closed contracts over the phone, this is an opportunity to put your skills to work in a high-energy, professional environment.



Compensation

$10/hour USD base pay



Plus Monthly Contract Bonuses for getting offers accepted:

• Bronze: 2 signed contracts = $500 bonus

• Silver: 3 signed contracts = $1,000 bonus

• Gold: 4 signed contracts = $1,500 bonus

• Platinum: 5+ signed contracts = $2,000 bonus



On-target earnings can range from $2,500–$3,500+ per month depending on performance. Pay dates are on the 1st and 15th of each month.



We believe in rewarding results. Our top performers earn meaningful bonuses based on closed contracts and consistent production.



Schedule

Full-time, Monday to Friday

9:00 AM – 6:00 PM CST

Remote position, work from your own secure setup



What You’ll Be Doing

- Engage with homeowners (seller leads), build authentic rapport, and manage conversations with professionalism

- Follow a proven acquisitions script while sounding natural and confident

- Ask strong follow-up questions to uncover seller motivation and property condition

- Make verbal offers, negotiate price and terms, and walk sellers through agreements using DocuSign

- Handle objections effectively and push deals forward toward signed contracts

- Maintain organized notes, offers, and seller updates in our CRM

- Collaborate closely with the acquisitions team and leadership



What It Takes to Succeed Here

- Relentless Follow-Up: Sellers don’t always respond the first time — or the second. You know how to stay persistent with calls, texts, and follow-ups until you get an answer. Nothing slips through the cracks on your watch.

- Extreme Attention to Detail: Every call, every note, every update gets logged correctly in the CRM. You don’t miss details, and you take pride in keeping your pipeline organized. If you’ve ever been called meticulous or “on top of everything,” this is where you’ll shine.

- Closer’s Mentality: You’re not just reading a script — you know how to listen, build rapport, and guide sellers toward a decision. You thrive on negotiation, handle objections with confidence, and create win-win agreements that get signed.

- Driven by Results: You measure success by contracts closed. You hold yourself to high standards and push to hit — and exceed — your targets consistently. You’re motivated by performance and driven by the satisfaction of closing successful deals.

- Resilient Problem-Solver: Whether it’s a tough seller, a pricing objection, or a complicated situation, you don’t freeze — you find solutions and move the deal forward. Challenges are part of the role, and you thrive in solving them under pressure.



Requirements

- Minimum 2+ years of experience in real estate acquisitions or seller negotiations

- Proven track record of closing real estate deals and securing signed contracts

- Excellent English communication skills (spoken and written)

- Confidence and professionalism on the phone; ability to build trust and rapport quickly

- Familiarity with real estate terms like ARV, repairs, inspection, contingencies, etc.

- Strong work ethic, coachability, and ability to follow scripts while sounding natural

- Proficiency with CRMs and outbound dialers

- Reliable high-speed internet, updated computer, and a quiet workspace



What We’re Looking For

- A confident, friendly, and persuasive communicator who thrives on results

- Someone who is organized, detail-oriented, and relentless in follow-up

- A professional with the drive to close contracts and grow with a fast-moving team



Why Join Us?

- Competitive pay with structured bonuses

- Real opportunities for growth in a professional investment company

- Work remotely with a team that supports your success

- A chance to close real deals, make a real impact, and develop long-term career skills in acquisitions



At Price Real Estate Investments, acquisitions is the heartbeat of our business. You’ll be in the front seat, driving growth and learning the strategies that power real deals across multiple U.S. markets.



How to Apply: (Read Carefully – Incomplete Applications Will Be Ignored)

-
 us at: 

- Subject line: Real Estate Acquisitions Application – OJPH

- Attach your resume with relevant real estate or sales experience

- Include a 1–2 minute audio or video introduction about yourself and experience.



Only applicants who follow all instructions will be considered.

title: Experienced Ecom Video Editor (UGC & AI Ads)
description:
Sereni Parenting is looking for an experienced Ecommerce Video Editor with a proven track record editing high-converting ads for ecommerce brands.



This is not an entry-level role. We want someone who has edited real ads, for real brands, that had to perform. General content creation or personal projects only? This role isn't for you.



Who We Are



Sereni is a fast-growing parenting brand creating calming solutions for children. We're marketers obsessed with performance and emotionally driven storytelling. Our ads run on Meta and need to hook fast, hold attention, and convert.



What You'll Be Doing



Editing short-form UGC and AI-generated video ads (1–3 mins) for direct response. You'll work from detailed creative briefs, your job is to bring them to life in a way that stops the scroll and drives action. 



What We're Looking For



- 3+ years editing experience, with at least 2 years on paid social ads for ecommerce brands - name the brands, we'll ask.

- Strong grasp of direct response: hooks, pacing, retention, emotional pull

- Hands-on experience with AI tools such as ElevenLabs, Kling, or similar

- Proficient in CapCut and/or Adobe Premiere Pro

- Can source b-roll and stock footage independently

- Fast communicator who meets deadlines without being chased



Communication is non-negotiable. Go quiet, miss deadlines, or can't take feedback - this isn't for you.



What We Offer



This is a remote, per-project role with consistent daily work available. Editors who deliver 2 videos a day can expect to earn $1,000–$2,000+ per month. Editors who consistently deliver quality and volume move into a fixed full-time role within 2–3 months.



How to Apply



Your application must include all 3 or it will not be reviewed:



1. Resume: including specific ecommerce brands you've edited for

2. Portfolio : links to real ad creative you've edited (ads only, not general content)

3. Include the phrase "ECOM UGC" in your application title. Applications without both will be immediately rejected.

title: Google Sheets Data Analyst – Ecommerce KPI Dashboard Build (Project-Based)

Create automated KPI dashboards



Build SKU-level and style-level profitability tracking



Create pivot tables and automated ranking tables



Implement rolling 7-day and 14-day ASP metrics



Build stream-level summary tables



Document SOP so our VA can maintain it



The system must:



Auto-calculate Nike vs Adidas performance



Track ASP by style and SKU



Automatically rank top 20 and bottom 20 SKUs



Calculate contribution per unit



Track variety index (unique SKUs / units sold)



Require minimal manual updates after setup



We want a one-time build with light revision support.

title: Technical Sales rep - Construction Products
description:
Our company is an Australian based distributor of construction related products with 20 years experience. We supply to home owners, builders and other trade professionals throughout Australia.



We currently have a vacancy for another Technical Sales Representative to join our Philippines based virtual team.



Your primary responsibility & duties will include:-

Reaching out to suitable businesses to uncover sales opportunities for our products, by phone and
.



Answering inbound phone calls /
s / chat messages and providing product information or sales quotes, and logging information into our CRM software.



Following up on previous quotes or information sent to customers to make a sale.



Skills required:

You will need to have very good English speaking and writing skills, as well as a pleasant clear phone manner.



An understanding of, or ability to quickly learn about construction products like insulation, pipe lagging, soundproofing etc.



The ability to calculate the area of a space and use basic mathematics is essential



Sales skills and the ability to close a deal.



An acute attention to details.



Previous experience in an insulation, soundproofing or construction customer service or sales position will be highly regarded



You MUST have:

An excellent (40 MBPS minimum) internet connection, good computer and good quality head set. ( a back up power supply if you live in power blackout areas)

Ability to use excel spreadsheets, CRM software, phone software etc

Ability to follow instructions clearly.



Work Hours:

8 hours per day, 5 days a week Monday to Friday. Very early Am starts will necessary due to time zone differences.



Remuneration will be a base of 35,000PHP monthly with commissions of up to 65,000PHP based on sales achieved.



Having good verbal and written English skills is essential. You will be required to attend a virtual interview via Google Meet



Training will be provided virtually also.



To be considered for the position please reply to 
 with brief details of your previous relative experience.



Only candidates we deem suitable will be contacted for an interview.



Many thanks. We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Short-Form Video Editor (Reels / TikTok / Shorts)
description:
Short-Form Video Editor (Reels / TikTok / Shorts)+ Being Able to edit Long Form a huge plus



Rate: $4–$6/hr (USD) to start

Commitment: Part-Time ? Long-Term

Schedule: Flexible

Language: Fluent English required



About the Role



I’m hiring a short-form video editor who already knows how to create high-engagement social media reels.



This is not a beginner role and not a general VA position.



Your primary responsibility is simple:



Turn raw talking-head videos into compelling, cohesive reels that people actually watch, comment on, and share.



If you already edit reels daily and understand pacing, hooks, and storytelling, this will feel natural WITHOUT using an AI tool.



What You’ll Be Editing



Mostly Talking-head videos (business, sales, mindset, strategy), sometimes DIY videos, categories may expand. to start- the clips will be:

Clips that need contextual cutting, not random trimming

Content designed to drive:

Watch time

Comments

DMs

Sales



What You MUST Already Know How To Do



You must already be able to:



You MUST Already Know How To:



? Edit short-form vertical videos (9:16)

? Cut based on meaning and flow, not just time

? Listen carefully to the words and maintain context

? Identify hooks and strong 
nts

? Remove filler, long pauses, and dead space

? Add clean, readable captions

? Compile multiple clips into one cohesive reel

? Export platform-ready videos







If you need step-by-step training on how to edit reels, this is not the role.



Tools You Should Already Use



You should already be comfortable with at least one:

CapCut

FinalCutPro

DaVinci

Adobe Premiere / After Effects

Canva experience is a bonus, not required.





Bonus (Not Required, But Valuable)

Experience editing coaches / educators / thought leaders

Understanding of hook styles that drive comments

Ability to match tone, pacing, and energy to brand voice

Familiarity with trending formats (without copying blindly)



Why Work With Me



I create high-volume, high-impact content across multiple brands in business, sales, and personal development.



This is not one-off editing.

If we work well together, you get:

? Consistent work

? Clear feedback and direction

? Creative freedom within structure

? Long-term stability

? Opportunity to increase pay quickly

? Training and Development



I value editors who think, not just click buttons.



Pay & Growth



???? $4/hr to start

???? Raise after 30–60 days based on output & quality

? Flexible hours (deadlines matter, not time zones)



Paid Trial (Required)

Shortlisted applicants will complete a paid test edit:

Edit provided raw clips into one cohesive reel using your judgment.

This is how I choose.



How to Apply (IMPORTANT — FILTERING IN PLACE)



To apply, send ONE message that includes:



1. A short intro: Name, country, years editing short-form content

“How do you d
 which parts of a video to cut for a reel?”

Subject Line / First Line Must Say: “REELS EDITOR – I EDIT FOR CONTEXT”

title: Senior Accountant- U.S. Property Management Company
description:
JOB SUMMARY:   



***MUST ATTACH RESUME TO BE CONSIDERED***

***Solid knowledge of financial accounting and GAAP***

***Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and AppFolio***

Compensation: Up to $2,000 monthly DOE plus 40 hours of paid sick leave after the first 90 days 

Schedule: 8:30 am - 5 pm PST  (flexible with start time)



The Senior Commercial Accountant manages financial records and ensures accurate reporting utilizing AppFolio software. This role is crucial for maintaining the organization’s financial health by overseeing financial activities in your property portfolio. You will prepare and maintain records, including general ledgers, analysis reports, financial reports, annual audits, tax preparation, and investor distributions.



Required Experience:

•	Minimum 5 years of experience in commercial or retail property management accounting (REQUIRED)

•	Strong knowledge of CAM reconciliations and audits (REQUIRED)

•	Experience with due diligence projects and property acquisitions/dispositions

•	Proficiency in budgeting, forecasting, and forensic accounting

•	Experience with new property and lease set-up in accounting systems

•	Excellent understanding of lease interpretation and its financial implications (e.g., NNN/Base Year CAMs)

•	Strong communication and organizational skills

•	Advanced Excel skills and familiarity with property accounting software (Appfolio REQUIRED)



Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Financial Reporting & Analysis

•	Prepare and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports for multiple properties

•	Conduct cash flow analysis and support calculations such as Cash-on-Cash Return and IRR (preferred, not required)

General Ledger & Month-End Close

•	Reconcile and analyze general ledger accounts

•	Perform month-end and year-end closing procedures to ensure accurate financial reporting

Accounts & Reconciliations

•	Oversee and approve accounts payable and receivable

•	Reconcile bank accounts and other ledgers, resolving discrepancies in a timely manner

Tenant & Lease Accounting

•	Set up new leases in accounting systems

•	Review and interpret lease agreements to ensure accurate billing and compliance

•	Maintain tenant ledgers and support collections and lease administration

Common Area Maintenance (CAM)

•	Prepare annual and interim CAM reconciliations

•	Conduct and support CAM audits

Budgeting & Forecasting

•	Develop and manage property-level budgets and forecasts

•	Explain budget-to-actual variances and assist in capital call planning

Property Transactions

•	Manage accounting for property acquisitions and dispositions

•	Lead new property onboarding and data integration into financial systems

Distributions & Tax Compliance

•	Prepare monthly/quarterly investor distributions, including relevant documentation

•	Assist with non-resident tax filings and general tax compliance support

Audit & Compliance

•	Provide documentation and support for internal and external audits

•	Ensure compliance with all relevant accounting standards and lease terms

Ad Hoc Projects

•	Participate in special projects, process improvements, and cross-departmental initiatives as needed



Education and Experience:

• A bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or a related discipline is required.

• At least five years of related work experience as a senior accountant.

title: Follow-Up Manager
description:
Cash Now Philly closes over 100 deals a year across Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Delaware, and Maryland. We're not a startup figuring things out — we're a proven operation looking for two Follow-Up Managers to join our acquisitions team.

This role is all about lead reactivation. You'll be working through our CRM database of homeowners, identifying motivation, and setting up quality conversations for our acquisition reps. If you're comfortable in high-volume phone environments and know how to turn a "not interested" into a real conversation, this could be a great fit.



What the job looks like day-to-day:

Working in a predictive dialer (Salesforce, Zen Call) making hundreds of calls per day

Reactivating aged leads and identifying homeowners who are actually motivated to sell

Handling objections and keeping conversations moving forward

Logging detailed notes and dispositions in the CRM

Handing off real opportunities to our acquisition team with solid context



Who we're looking for:

At least 2 years of cold calling or outbound sales experience

Clear English communication — you'll be talking to homeowners across the US

Someone who can sit in a dialer queue all day and stay sharp

You listen more than you talk and know how to find motivation without being pushy

Real estate experience is a plus but not required — we'll train the right person



What we offer:

$5/hour base pay

Full-time, Monday through Friday, 9 AM to 7 PM Eastern

Fully remote

Training from a team that actually closes deals

A tight ship without micromanagement — show up, do the work, get better every day



How to apply:

We take hiring seriously. Expect a questionnaire, an assessment, and an interview. Don't copy/paste some generic application — we read every one. Include the code word "reactivate" somewhere in your submission.

If you're ready to work with a real team that performs, apply now.

title: Retail & Distributor Outreach Assistant (Part-Time, Contractor) plus commissions & bonuses
description:
About the Role



I’m the founder of a growing natural, vegan skincare and sunscreen brand based in the UK. I’m looking for a reliable, detail-oriented assistant to help manage outreach to retail stockists and distributors.



This role is suited to someone with sales or lead-generation experience who understands wholesale ecosystems and can confidently distinguish between brands, retailers/stockists, distributors, and competitors.



You’ll be responsible for keeping a high-quality outreach pipeline active and organised. I will handle closing and final negotiations.



Hours & Schedule



- Independent contractor role (hourly)



- Part-time: 12 hours per week



- Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday



- 4 hours per day



- Some overlap with UK business hours required



- Start date: ASAP



- Long-term role for the right person





Key Responsibilities



Outreach & Follow-Ups



- Send outreach
s to appropriate retail stockists and distributors



- Personalise
s thoughtfully (not mass outreach)



- Adapt and improve outreach templates over time



- Manage follow-ups and track responses clearly





Lead sourcing & tracking



- Track every account in a simple pipeline tracker or spreadsheet



- Correctly classify leads as:



- Company-Sourced (we provide the target company; you find contacts and manage follow-up)

- Assistant-Sourced (you independently identify a suitable retail stockist or distributor)



- Use judgement to flag borderline, strategic, or unsuitable accounts before outreach



- Confirm sourcing status in the tracker if unclear before spending time on it





Sales Cycle & Pipeline Support



- Support the sales process from prospecting to warm lead handover



- Qualify retailers and distributors based on brand fit



- Maintain clear notes on outreach status and next steps





Research & Prospecting



- Research and identify genuine multi-brand retail stockists and aligned distributors



- Identify correct buyers, founders, or category contacts



- Build and maintain a curated outreach list (quality over volume)





Communication & Reporting



- Clearly summarise replies and actions required



- Flag interested or time-sensitive leads promptly



- Maintain an organised spreadsheet or CRM





Requirements



- Experience in wholesale sales, B2B outreach, account management, or lead generation



- Clear understanding of the difference between:



- brands vs retailers/stockists

- competitors vs wholesale accounts

- boutiques vs large chains



- Understanding of the sales cycle and follow-up process



- Strong written English



- Excellent organisation and attention to detail



- Confident researching companies and decision-makers



- Comfortable using Google Sheets and/or CRMs (PipeDrive a plus)



- LinkedIn outreach experience preferred





What This Role Is Not



- No cold calling



- No closing or negotiation



- No aggressive sales tactics





Tools



- Gmail



- Google Sheets or CRM (PipeDrive)



- Templates, training, and brand materials provided



- Hubstaff used for time tracking (not micromanagement)





Pay



- PHP 250/hour, paid monthly



- Commission applies to the first paid order only from Assistant-Sourced accounts



- One-off bonuses apply to Company-Sourced accounts



- Commission/bonuses paid after cleared payment is received



(At 12 hours/week, approx. PHP 12,900/month + bonuses.)



How to Apply



 
 with ref SO26 and include:



- A short summary of your experience with sales, outreach, or wholesale support



- How you track outreach and follow-ups



- A short sample outreach
 introducing a natural skincare brand to a retail stockist



-A 1–2 minute Loom video explaining why you’re interested in this specific role and Baie Botanique



NB: Applications without a Loom link will not be reviewed.

title: Meta Partnership Ads ad publisher Specialist (9am–12pm AEST)
description:
Role Overview

This is an ad publishing (not strategist role)



We are looking for a highly organised and detail-oriented Meta Ads Specialist to manage the end-to-end execution/publishing of our Partnership Ads.



This is a high-volume, process-driven role. You will be responsible for publishing approximately 20 ads per day, managing usage rights, and coordinating closely with our Influencer Marketing team to ensure all assets and permissions are ready for launch.



Key Responsibilities

Ad Publishing: Launching ~20 Partnership Ads daily within Meta Ads Manager.

Request Management: Sending and tracking Partnership Ad requests to influencer accounts.

Usage Rights Tracking: Maintaining an organized system to monitor usage term end dates and ensuring no ads run past their legal limit.

Cross-Team Coordination: Communicating daily with our Influencer Marketing team to gather missing information, creative assets, or access.

Troubleshooting: Identifying and resolving issues with creator permissions or Meta Business Suite connections.



Requirements

Meta Ads Manager Expertise: You must have hands-on experience specifically with Partnership Ads (Branded Content).

Time Zone & Schedule: Must be available to work fixed hours between 9:00 AM and 12:00 PM AEST (Sydney Time), Monday through Friday.

Extreme Organisation: You will be handling high volumes of data; you must have a proven system for tracking deadlines and statuses.

Communication: Fluent English and the ability to work collaboratively with a remote team in real-time.

Reliability: This is a daily operation; we need someone who can commit to a steady, long-term routine.



Project Details

Hours: 3–4 hours per day (Strictly during Sydney mornings).

Budget: $18 AUD / hour.

Location: Remote, but must be able to commit to the AEST schedule.

Duration: Ongoing, long-term collaboration.

 and inbox support, including categorizing and routing
