title: Financial Operations Specialist (Remote)
description:
Remote Financial Operations Specialist (Full-Time VA – Philippines)

Own the Financial Engine at Property Rush



Be the Guardian of Our Numbers, Cash Flow, and Clarity

Are you an elite-level bookkeeper with CFO-level instincts? Do you thrive in building financial systems, forecasting cash flow, and producing clean, accurate books every single month? Are you the kind of person who finds errors before anyone else even sees the numbers?



If spreadsheets, reconciliations, and financial clarity are your love language — we want you.

We’re hiring a Full-Time Financial Operations Specialist (Remote) who will oversee the entire financial heartbeat of Property Rush. You’ll manage the books, own month-end close, produce financial statements, keep cash flow predictable, protect margins, and give leadership the clean data needed to make informed decisions.



This is a role for someone who is reliable, disciplined, detail-obsessed, and hungry for growth inside a fast-paced real estate company. This is not data-entry bookkeeping. This is high-ownership financial leadership!



__________________________________________________



???? Why You’ll Love This Role

Own the Financial Engine

You’ll run our entire financial workflow — from reconciliations to reporting to forecasting.



Be a Strategic Partner

You’ll work directly with the CEO and senior leadership team to ensure our numbers tell the truth and support growth.



Build the Systems That Scale Us

You’ll refine bookkeeping processes, automate workflows, and implement smarter financial controls.



Make a True Impact

When our numbers are tight, our business grows — and you’ll be at the center of that growth.



__________________________________________________



???? What You’ll Do

20% – BIG ROCKS (Critical Financial Responsibilities)

These are the highest-level, do-first, mission-critical responsibilities:

? Month-End Close (Complete Within 10 Days)

- Reconcile all accounts (cash, credit cards, loans, AR/AP, escrow, deposits).

- Generate accurate monthly financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow).

- Deliver clean, final books to leadership every month.



? Cash Flow Forecasting (12-Month Rolling)

- Maintain a real-time cash flow forecasting spreadsheet.

- Track all upcoming obligations and expected income.

- Keep forecast accuracy within 5% variance month over month.

- Plot all contractor invoices, recurring expenses, and property obligations before payment approval.



? Budgeting & Reporting

- Help build and maintain annual budget.

- Produce monthly variance reports (budget vs actual).

- Flag overspending, slow payers, or margin compression before it becomes a problem.



? Compliance & Tax Prep Support

- Maintain clean books for CPA review.

- Track 1099 vendors, reconcile receipts, and prepare files for tax season.

- Ensure real estate–specific compliance (security deposits, escrow tracking, PM fees, rehab costs).



? Process Improvement

- Build scalable bookkeeping systems.

- Automate workflows inside QuickBooks / Xero / Google Sheets.

- Improve accuracy and reduce manual entries.



__________________________________________________



80% – DAILY & WEEKLY FINANCIAL OPERATIONS

These are recurring tasks that keep our financial engine running:



?Accounts Payable

- Process vendor invoices.

- Verify job-cost accuracy for property rehabs.

- Ensure 100% on-time payments.



?Accounts Receivable

- Track incoming rents, investor payments, loan payments, and revenue.

- Follow up on late payments with professionalism.



?Payroll & Contractor Payments

- Prepare payroll reports for U.S. processor.

- Track hours, reimbursements, and recurring contractor fees.



?Property-Level Bookkeeping

- Track rehab budgets, cost overruns, and job costing by line item.

- Reconcile utility bills, rent rolls, deposits, escrows.



?Financial Organization

- Maintain organized digital filing for statements, invoices, and documents.

- Keep leadership’s financial dashboard updated weekly.



?Weekly/Monthly Reporting

- Weekly cash position update.

- Weekly AR/AP status.

- Weekly/Monthly KPI dashboard.



__________________________________________________



???? KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)

These metrics define success in this role:

???? Month-End Close Completed by Day 10

100% on-time delivery every month.



???? Financial Accuracy – Zero Material Errors

Books must tie out to the penny — consistently.



???? Cash Flow Forecast Accuracy

Maintain ? 5% variance between forecasted vs. actual cash flow.



???? 100% On-Time Vendor Payments

No late payments without prior approval



???? Clean Books for CPA Review

No major findings or issues during annual tax prep or audits.



???? Cost Savings Identified & Executed

Help us lower expenses and improve margins every single quarter.



__________________________________________________



? You’re a Fit If You…

- Are detail-obsessed and take pride in accuracy.

- Love creating order, clarity, and clean numbers.

- Work fast, independently, and don’t need daily supervision.

- Think like a controller, not a clerk — you see the big picture.

- Can manage multiple entities (LLCs, flips, rentals, PM).

- Understand real estate bookkeeping (ideal, but not required if you learn fast).

- Are hungry, humble, proactive, and solution-oriented.

- Want long-term, stable, full-time work.



__________________________________________________



???? Skills & Requirements

- 3+ years bookkeeping/accounting experience (real estate preferred).

- Strong QuickBooks Online or Xero experience.

- Strong Excel/Google Sheets skills (pivot tables, formulas, formatting).

- Experience with AP/AR, reconciliations, and financial reporting.

- Fluent English (written and verbal).

- Reliable computer + internet.

- Ability to work U.S. hours (EST preferred).

- Experience with multi-entity bookkeeping is a major plus.



__________________________________________________



???? Perks & Benefits

- Full-time, long-term remote role.

- Work directly with the CEO.

- Growth path toward Finance Manager / Controller.

- Paid time off + paid PH holidays.

- Access to training & development resources.

- Stable, meaningful role inside a mission-driven U.S. real estate company.



__________________________________________________



???? Why Join Property Rush?

We’re a fast-growing real estate investment and property management company focused on stewardship, integrity, and growth (S.I.G.). Our mission is to provide affordable, quality housing while building a thriving business and strong investment community.

If you want to join a team that values accuracy, excellence, and continuous improvement — you’ll feel at home here.



__________________________________________________



???? Ready to Lead Our Financial Systems?

If you’re a meticulous bookkeeper who can think strategically and deliver clean books every month, we’d love to meet you.

???? Apply now and help us scale with confidence.



__________________________________________________



As part of our pre-screening process, we kindly ask you to complete both the Culture Index and Personality Assessment provided below. Completing these assessments is required for us to move your application to the next stage. Only applicants who completed the assessments will be processed.



1. Culture Index Assessment

(Copy and paste this link into a new browser tab)





2. Personality Assessment

title: Online Installations Technician
description:
As an Online Installation Technician, you will play a critical role in remotely supporting the installation of AI systems in the U.S. This is a fully remote contractor position where you will guide on-the-ground technicians through various installation steps, ensuring successful implementation and troubleshooting of any issues that arise. Your expertise in hardware, software, and troubleshooting will be essential in maintaining smooth operations and delivering high-quality support to our partners and customers. Payment for this role is on an hourly basis.



You would bring:

- Excellent Communication Skills: Proficient in English with an easy-to-understand accent, confidence in speaking, and smooth communication skills.

- Technical Equipment: Dedicated work PC with a fast and stable internet connection, sufficient RAM, and adequate memory.

- Experience: Proven experience in handling communication in English, including calls and interactions with various business partners.

- Technical Expertise: Familiarity with hardware, software, and troubleshooting. This role requires candidates who can handle technical tasks beyond basic help, such as adjusting laptop brightness or taking screenshots.

- Stress Management: Ability to remain calm and take control of situations under stress.

- Self-Learning Ability: A fast learner with the capability to research and troubleshoot issues independently before seeking assistance.

- Organizational Skills: Well-organized and detail-oriented approach to work.

- Full-Time Commitment: Willingness to dedicate full time to the role, with the opportunity for growth and development within the company.

- Flexibility: Ability to work long shifts when needed, with the understanding that Field Engineers (FEs) may need to stay late until the job is done.



About the role:

- Remote Position: This is a fully remote job where you will work from your location, managing installations and support virtually.

- Collaboration: Work closely with on-site technicians to complete AI system installations, including troubleshooting issues during the process. You will guide the on-the-ground technician through various installation steps.

- Communication: Effectively communicate with external personnel from our partners and customers as needed.

- Task Management: Handle installation-related tasks assigned by the company.



Please fill out the form so we can get started!

title: Estimator
description:
Position Overview

We are seeking a motivated Estimator to join our Structural Steel and Miscellaneous Metals team. This internship provides hands-on experience in commercial construction estimating, including takeoffs, bid preparation, scope analysis, and pricing strategy.

You will work directly with our estimating and leadership team to help price structural steel, stairs, guardrails, gates, ornamental metals, and other miscellaneous metal scopes for commercial projects.

This is an ideal opportunity for students pursuing Construction Management, Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, or a related field who are interested in preconstruction and cost analysis within the steel industry.

Company Overview

Mastercraft Iron Co. Inc is a full-service family owned structural steel and ornamental iron company with over 30 years’ experience.

Our fabrication shop is over 45,000 SQF with state-of-the-art machinery.

We specialize in commercial buildings, large multi-unit residential projects, bridges and single-family homes.

We also provide design build engineering and calculations for new structures and retrofit projects

All estimating detailing and engineering are done in-house. We meet all AWS and Cal OSHA safety and standard requirements as required for an L.A city approved fabricator shop.

What You’ll Learn

• How to perform structural steel quantity takeoffs

• How to read and interpret structural and architectural drawings

• Understanding steel scopes (structural vs. miscellaneous metals)

• Material pricing and labor cost breakdowns

• Bid leveling and scope gap analysis

• How to prepare competitive and complete bid proposals

• Value engineering (VE) strategies

• How to communicate with General Contractors and vendors during bid process

Key Responsibilities

• Assist in performing quantity takeoffs from structural and architectural drawings

• Review plans and specifications to identify scope requirements

• Help prepare bid spreadsheets and pricing breakdowns

• Contact vendors and suppliers for material pricing

• Assist with scope clarifications and exclusions

• Support proposal preparation and submission

• Track bid deadlines and maintain organized estimating files

• Participate in pre-bid meetings (when applicable)

Qualifications

• Currently pursuing a degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, or related field

• Strong interest in commercial construction and structural steel

• Ability to read construction drawings (preferred but not required)

• Proficient in Bluebeam Revu

• Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Word

• Strong analytical and mathematical skills

• Detail-oriented and organized

• Strong communication skills

What We’re Looking For

• We’re looking for individuals who are:

• Hungry to learn and grow in the construction industry

• Comfortable in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment

• Interested in eventually becoming a Project Engineer or Project Manager

• Willing to take ownership of tasks and follow through

Why Join Us?

• Hands-on exposure to real commercial construction bids

• Mentorship from experienced estimators and leadership

• Involvement in high-value structural steel projects

• Ability to receive hands-on experience in fabrication, installation, and project coordination

• Opportunity for full-time employment in estimating, engineering, project management, or preconstruction upon graduation

title: Job Title: TikTok Ads Media Buyer (MUST Have TikTok Experience)
description:
?? IMPORTANT — READ BEFORE APPLYING



These are not 70 FULL hours, I need someone available from when ads launch in the morning to when ads stop at night, 7 days a week. However each hour this will only require 10/15 minutes of your time! 



This role is TikTok-specific. If you do not have real TikTok Ads media buying experience, please do not apply.



You must also be flexible with working hours. We run products in both the UK and US markets, which means campaigns operate across different time zones. Some days will require UK hours, other days US hours, depending on what is being scaled.



And you MUST be available to work 7 days a week, bumping budgets briefly every hour. 

Payment to be negotiated, but will include bonus's if KPI's are met. 



?



About the Role



We are looking for a highly reliable TikTok Ads Media Buyer who is comfortable operating inside a strict, structured optimization system.



You will be given a detailed prompt sheet that guides every decision. Each hour, you will submit campaign screenshots into the system, which will tell you exactly what actions to take (budget bumps, reductions, or no action).



This is a performance-focused execution role — precision and consistency matter more than guesswork.



?



Availability & Hours (Important)



This role requires availability throughout the week to perform hourly check-ins.



However, this is not full-time hourly work — each check-in typically takes around 10–20 minutes, not a full hour. The job is focused on monitoring and making quick optimization decisions rather than continuous work.



We are looking for someone who:

 • Can remain available during agreed campaign hours

 • Is comfortable with frequent short check-ins

 • Understands this role is based on availability + execution, not constant workload



Compensation structure will be discussed during hiring so expectations are clear from both sides.



?



Responsibilities

 • Manage and optimize TikTok ad campaigns using a structured workflow

 • Submit hourly campaign screenshots and follow prompt-driven decisions

 • Execute budget scaling and optimization actions exactly as instructed

 • Monitor performance closely and maintain consistency across campaigns

 • Communicate clearly if anything falls outside the system’s rules



?



Requirements

 • Proven experience running TikTok Ads (non-negotiable)

 • Strong understanding of TikTok ad metrics, scaling, and optimization

 • Comfortable working with strict systems and clear instructions

 • High attention to detail and ability to follow rules precisely

 • Flexible availability to match UK & US campaign time zones

 • Reliable internet and strong communication skills



?



Who This Role Is Perfect For

 • Media buyers who prefer clear systems over guesswork

 • Operators who are fast, disciplined, and process-driven

 • People comfortable with short, frequent optimization windows



?



How to Apply



Please send:

 • Your TikTok Ads experience (accounts or niches worked on)

 • Results or case studies (if available)

 • A short message explaining why you’re a good fit for a structured, rule-based workflow

title: Daily Profit Tracker for Shopify
description:

Responsibilities:

title: Welcome to K-POP Universe : Office Admin Role for E-Commerce ! Join the Beat !
description:
- Recruitment validity period: Until 3 business days from the date of the first recruitment announcement

- A PH VA team of more than 5 people has already been formed, and business collaboration is possible using Tagalog in a comfortable atmosphere.

- Providing educational tutorial videos and operating a mentorship program to help new comers quickly adapt



[About Us]

* Company Introduction (Video):

youtu.be/dO2mWWZANx8



[Join Summitree and Write Your K-POP Legacy Alongside Filipinos]

Summitree envisions leveraging their Filipino employees' intelligence and English fluency to expand globally while sharing their passion for K-POP. They highlight the Philippines' crucial role in their expansion plans, emphasizing collaboration with their Filipino team to make a mark in the K-POP world. Joining Summitree means joining a multicultural team (Korea, Philippines, Mongolia, Others) with a shared goal of making K-POP history.



[Responsibilities]

We are looking for a “Full-Time” Office Admin to handle our business.

You will be doing a variety of tasks, almost all of which we will create tutorials for you.

1. Order fulfillment and shipping label generation

You will be responsible for gathering and processing customer orders accurately and efficiently. This includes coordinating with third-party logistics (3PL) providers for inbound and outbound shipments to ensure smooth operations.

2. Product listing and scheduling

As a distributor of K-POP records and merchandise, you will be involved in registering new products into our system. This includes managing inventory, updating product information, and ensuring accurate data entry. Additionally, you will be responsible for scheduling release dates and managing timelines using tools like Google Calendar.

3. Sales & Marketing

You will be responsible for studying and trying how to gain traffics to our shopping mall. Active working on research articles related to SEO, social marketing and finding where and how to promote our shopping mall is required.

4. Customer service support

providing excellent customer service is crucial to us. You will be responsible for addressing customer inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring customer satisfaction. Your communication skills and problem-solving abilities will play a vital role in maintaining strong relationships with our valued customers.



[Required qualifications & skillset (must have)]

* Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

* Experience in puchasing K-POP Album or knowledge of K-POP related products (album, merchandise)

* Idea of how to promote K-POP albums and gain traffics in our shopping mall in PH online K-POP community for each artists



[Desired qualifications & skillset (nice to have)]

* Experience in handling customer service

* Experience in Photoshop

* Experience in
 Ads or Google Ads

* Knowledge and Experience of Microsoft Excel & Familar with Using Various Formula

* Experience in experience in Amazon Business (Familiar with Interface and function) or other E-commerce Platform



[Compensation & Employment Terms]

* ONLY Looking for a full time employee

* $300~$400/mo. determined based on the candidate’s skills, experience, and overall evaluation relative to other applicants

* One-year renewable Contract

- Compensation and terms may be adjusted based on attendance, teamwork, and performance.

- Exceptional performers may be considered for early renewal or adjustment. (multiple successful cases)

* 6-month probationary period with possibility of early conversion to regular position based on performance (multiple successful cases)



[Perks & Benefits]

1. Regular Employee Benefits

- 13th Month Salary provided

- 10 additional paid leave days upon regularization

2. Birthday Benefit (After 6 Months of Employment)

- Receive one free K-POP album of your favorite artist on your birthday

3. Paid Holidays (Regardless of Employment Status)

- January 1st (New Year’s Day) and Christmas Day are paid holidays

- Applies to both probationary and regular employees

4. Performance-Based Incentives

- Additional incentives may be provided during high-performance sales periods

(Example: major comeback seasons for artists such as BTS or Stray Kids)

5. Long Service Incentive Program

- 1-Year Service / 3-Year Service / 5-Year Service



[How To Apply for the job]

Just Fill out 10 Simple Questions through Google Form





Interview via google meet will be conducted after first screening and candidates will be notifed to their
s or
 



Thank you



Human Resource Dept.

Summitree

title: Sales & Applications Engineer (DIRECT CLIENT)
description:
(Electrical Engineering background preferred)



We are seeking a technically competent Engineer — preferably with an Electrical Engineering background — to work closely with Voltech (
) in a combined Sales and Applications Support capacity.



This is not an administrative sales role. The position requires a technically capable individual who can confidently engage with engineers and manufacturers, understand their test setups, and provide practical application guidance both before and after the sale.



The successful candidate will act as a technical bridge between customers, the sales team, and Voltech’s engineering and service departments.



Role Overview

The Sales & Applications Engineer is responsible for supporting both prospective and existing customers through pre-sales consultation and post-sales technical assistance.



This includes:

Understanding the customer’s test environment, setup, and application requirements

Advising on appropriate Voltech product configurations

Assisting Sales Administration with technical inquiries

Providing first-line troubleshooting and application guidance

Escalating verified issues to engineering when required

The role requires analytical thinking, electrical test knowledge, and the ability to interpret schematics, wiring configurations, and test parameters.



Key Responsibilities

Pre-Sales / Sales Engineering Support

Respond to pre-sales technical inquiries and guide customers on product capabilities and suitability

Engage with customers to understand their setup, test objectives, wiring configuration, and measurement requirements

Assist Sales Admin when customers raise technical questions beyond basic commercial details

Prepare and issue quotations for custom test fixtures based on customer requirements and technical specifications

Coordinate or conduct pre-sales testing of customer samples when required

Work directly with Voltech to clarify technical feasibility and configuration details



Applications & Post-Sales Support

Provide technical support via
, phone, Microsoft Teams, or TeamViewer

Assist customers with product setup, configuration, and troubleshooting

Replicate customer issues where possible using similar setups or customer samples

Offer application guidance for transformer testing and wound component measurements

Escalate confirmed bugs or product issues to the development/engineering team

Provide updates to customers regarding bug fixes or technical resolutions

Collaborate with Service Administration for warranty claims and RMA coordination



Ideal Candidate Profile

Degree in Electrical Engineering or related technical field

Strong understanding of electrical test principles, measurement systems, or transformer/wound component testing (preferred)

Comfortable communicating with engineers and technical manufacturers

Able to interpret schematics and technical specifications

Strong problem-solving and analytical skills

Professional communication skills for customer-facing interactions



Kindly send your CV LINK. NO CV LINK - skipped.

title: TikTok Shop Relationship Manager
description:
About the Role

We are looking for people with true owner mindset, not task-doers. Someone to take 100% responsibility for creator relationships and collaborations for our TikTok Shop brands.

You will need to IMMERSE yourself in the subject and quickly learn how to proactively FIND the right creators, figure out the best ways to reach them, ensure they are active, cultivate relationships so they know they can count on us, and overall ensure they are producing well.



Important

This is NOT a robotic or auto-message role. While mass messaging is handled by the team you will be responsible to bring the extra touch necessary to cultivate the most productive Creator relationships.

We expect you to come with knowledge and experience; then study up and figure things out when you run into unfamiliar problems or when TikTok implements changes and launches new features. All of us do the same and in turn we share our newly gained knowledge and skills as internal training with the rest of the team.



Key Responsibilities

Fully own creator relationships for several brands

Understand TikTok Shop US backend

Identify and onboard the right TikTok creators

Manage free samples and track content delivery

Secure Spark Ads codes and coordinate with the team

Continuously find new and better ways to reach high-quality creators

Provide clear reports and proactive recommendations to the team and clients



Qualifications

Can work EST 9 am to 5 pm weekdays

Working experience in TikTok Shop backend (US marketplace REQUIRED)

Familiarity to get around and understand what is what in TikTok Shop

Perfect English to work with creators, our team and clients

Extreme self-starter: you research, find, and take initiative without hand-holding

Ability to learn quickly and immediately putting that knowledge to use effectively

Zero tolerance for robotic or copy-paste work



How to Apply (Important – only serious applicants)

Reply with:

1) Your updated resume

2) A brief example of a time you are proud of having learnt something quickly and putting that to use fast

3) A short paragraph (3-5 sentences) telling us about a specific time you independently reached out to a creator with a personal message that worked. If you do not have such actual experience explain why you think you could handle a situation like that.



If you want an opportunity to make a difference and be part of an effective team, this is your chance!

Are you a people person with a drive to see Creators succeed selling our products?

We have the perfect position for you!

/Instagram). This role requires expertise in direct response creative that must match the aesthetic and quality of 8-figure direct-to-consumer (DTC) brands and immediately stop the scroll.

Portfolio is CRITICAL: Your submitted portfolio must immediately match or exceed the quality standard set by top-tier DTC brands. We are looking for clean, modern design with scroll-stopping visuals, strong typography, and expert product photography integration.



DTC & Meta Ad Expertise: You must have 3+ years of professional experience designing Meta static ads for DTC brands. Must understand Direct Response Marketing (DRM) and be able to create mobile-first designs incorporating social proof and compelling hooks.



Technical Mastery: Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop/Illustrator mastery is a must).



Work Style: Ability to iterate quickly and respond to performance data. Must be deadline-driven with a fast turnaround capability.



Compensation & Structure:

title: Experienced Content/Social Media Manager VA
description:
SOCIAL MEDIA MANAGER VA (FULL TIME, REMOTE)



We are looking for a strategic, creative and highly driven Content/Social Media Manager who knows how to grow personal brand accounts fast, organically and with intention. We need someone who will drive the production of our content ops forward, be able to keep production timelines, update information in uploads as required, and send reminders to the relevant people.



Excellent
 management and very high attention to detail a must. 



If you love studying viral trends, testing hooks, and turning great ideas into clear content plans, this role is for you.



About the role



You will be responsible for the end to end management of the founder's content production systems across Podcast, Instagram, TikTok, Substack and YouTube. Your focus is simple: help reach hundreds of thousands of new followers in the next few months among US and European audiences, while keeping the brand coherent, high quality and on message.



This is a long term remote role, starting with a full time contractor position, with the possibility to grow into a core tea
mber.



Key responsibilities



Own the content calendar for Instagram, TikTok and YouTube, including Reels, Shorts, long form, carousels and Stories



Do daily and weekly viral trend research in relevant niches and suggest specific content angles and hooks



Turn voice notes, transcripts, raw ideas and old content into structured content plans and scripts



Coordinate with video editors and designers so that every piece is on brand and delivered on time



Plan and schedule posts using appropriate tools, optimising for reach, retention and watch time



Write titles, hooks, captions and CTAs that are compelling and scroll stopping



Monitor analytics, run simple experiments and report what is working, what is not and what to try next



Help build simple systems so the content machine runs smoothly each week



Proactively suggest ideas to “growth hack” the brand, collaborations, content series, live formats and more



What I am looking for



Proven experience growing social media accounts organically, ideally for a personal brand, creator or influencer



Strong understanding of viral content mechanics, hooks, retention and platform specific best practices



Confident working across Instagram, TikTok and YouTube, with a clear view of how each platform differs



Excellent written English, especially for short form hooks and captions



Highly organised and detail oriented, able to manage multiple pieces of content and deadlines at once



Comfortable working with content from business, money, mindset, entrepreneurship and personal growth themes



Proactive “owner” mindset, you spot opportunities and problems before I do and come with solutions



Stable internet, good availability on WhatsApp or similar, and willingness to work with overlap to European or US time zones



Nice to have



Experience working with founders, coaches, consultants or educators



Familiarity with tools like Notion, Trello, Asana, or similar for content organisation



Basic understanding of YouTube SEO and thumbnail strategy



What you get



Opportunity to build and scale a personal brand in the money, business and mindset space



Long term, stable work with room to grow your responsibilities and compensation based on performance



Creative freedom to test ideas, formats and series as long as they align with brand strategy



Direct access to the founder and a chance to help build systems and processes from the ground up



How to apply



Please apply with:



A short introduction about you and your experience with personal brands or influencers



Links to three accounts you have managed and what specific results you helped achieve



One page or a few screenshots of a sample content calendar you have created



Send your application with CV and intro by
 to 

 with the subject line

“Social Media Growth Manager – [Your Name]” 



AND submit via the platform.



Please include an introduction, your most impressive SMM work experience / the results you produced and why you are the ideal candidate for the role.

title: Construction project coordinator
description:
Department: Project Management

Reports To: Project Manager (Senior PM / GM CC’d as required)

Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time, Non-Exempt



Who is Team RRE?

We are team players who prioritize open communication while exercising emotional control. We do the right thing and are dedicated to winning. We are not perfect—we learn from our mistakes in the process of being great.



Team RRE Core Values

We Are Team Players

We Prioritize Open Communication

We Exercise Emotional Control

We Do the Right Thing

We Are Dedicated to Winning



Vision

To be the greatest nationwide, relationship-based electrical contractor with the best culture for our tea
mbers.



Purpose

To serve our clients with the highest level of communication and provide maximum value in order to build long-term, relationship-based partnerships.



What’s In It for You

Strong, winning Team culture

Permanent, full-time position

Growth opportunities as we expand locally and nationwide

Access to company health plan (Kaiser Permanente)

Dental and vision coverage

Retirement plan

Six paid holidays per year



Position Overview

The Project Coordinator is a critical support role responsible for relieving Project Managers of coordination, documentation, tracking, and field-support responsibilities so projects are executed efficiently, profitably, and professionally.

This role serves as a central communication hub between Project Managers, field tea
mbers, vendors, clients, and general contractors. Extreme organization, proactive communication, emotional control, and a strong desire to help Team RRE win are required.



Key Responsibilities & Tasks

Project Setup

Prepare job folders upon contract award and ensure all documents are properly organized in Google Drive.

Coordinate and distribute startup documentation, including:

Certificates of Insurance (including additional insured)

Business licenses

Joint Check Agreements

Team Introduction Letters

Communicate with material vendors (e.g., Platt) to establish job accounts.

Assist Project Managers with job costing worksheets and ensure Accounting loads projects into QuickBooks.

Prepare Statements of Values and load them into Google Sheets and Contractor Foreman.

Address and track all required submittals.



Tracking & Documentation

Track schedules and coordinate all active work.

Track daily site reports and store them in the appropriate folders.

Track site photos and organize albums by job phase and date.

Receive incoming job-related
s and route critical requests to the Project Manager per direction.

Update each job’s status line weekly.

Generate a Weekly Job Team Talk (WJTT) Google Doc for every active job, serving as the official weekly update.



Weekly Job Team Talks (WJTT)

Prepare, distribute, and track WJTTs for every job, every week.

Ensure WJTTs clearly communicate:

Job progress

Schedule status

Labor hours and production

Material status and deliveries

Risks, constraints, and next steps

Coordinate WJTTs with jobsite Leads and GC on-site supervisors as required.

Store all WJTT documentation in Google Drive per Team RRE standards.



Contractor Foreman Tasks

Load jobs into Contractor Foreman, including plans, documents, and communications.

Ensure Daily Logs are completed and tracked.

Load new field tea
mbers, assign roles, and verify system access.

Support onboarding by ensuring field tea
mbers can access the app and locate assigned jobs.

Keep Contractor Foreman clean and current as jobs close out.

Ensure end-of-month job inspections and percentage-of-completion updates are completed and posted.





Field Support, Materials & Equipment

Order and coordinate materials and equipment per approved job budgets.

Track material deliveries and equipment usage to support field productivity.

Monitor equipment rentals and usage to minimize unnecessary costs.

Assist Purchasing with large material orders, equipment vendors, pricing, approvals, and follow-ups.

Coordinate lodging and per diem requirements for field tea
mbers.

Assist with weekly mileage tracking and verification for payroll.

Receive and reconcile tooling lists; track missing tools, ladders, and equipment.



Change Orders & Financial Support

Prepare change orders for:

Time & Material work

Scope changes or additions

Overtime work

Equipment-driven requirements

Assist with retainage tracking, invoicing, collections, and Schedule of Values.

Prepare monthly progress billings (manager approval required).

Receive, review, and process payment applications.

Log and track all change orders from initiation through invoicing.



Training & Development

Demonstrates self-awareness of strengths and development needs.

Owns and actively manages a career path toward maximum potential.

Self-motivated, lifelong learner committed to continuous improvement.

Continuously upgrades job knowledge and emotional control.

Asks questions, communicates clearly, takes ownershipand dedicated to winning.



Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Strong organizational and multitasking skills with attention to detail.

Proficient in Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail) and Contractor Foreman.

Great written and verbal communication skills.

Take massive action to get things done.

Professional, tactful, and service-oriented client interaction.

Ability to build and maintain strong professional relationships with clients.

Emotional Control: Ability to manage personal emotions and positively influence others.



Education & Experience

Construction or electrical industry experience preferred; formal education not required.



Core Competencies

Very high productivity

Understands massive action

Strong ownership mentality

Great financial accountability

Calm under pressure

Organized and detail-oriented

Clear communicator

Team-first, solutions-driven mindset



Why Join Team RRE

Strong culture built on values, not ego

Growing company with a long-term vision

Leadership that cares about people—not just numbers

Opportunity to grow into senior leadership as the company scales

title: Customer Care Specialist - Remote
description:
About MyMagicHealer

MyMagicHealer is a mission-driven skincare brand supporting people with painful, sensitive skin flare-ups. Many people come to us after searching for answers and natural ways to support their skin.

In Customer Care, we are the bridge between the brand and the customer.

Every message matters.

Every interaction shapes how someone feels about their healing journey.

We’re building a high-performing Customer Care department and would love for you to join our mission-driven team.



Read below if you’re a fit.



Who This Role Is For

This role is for someone who:

Thinks critically instead of waiting for instructions

Can operate confidently even when processes aren’t fully built

Understands customers and adapts support to different situations

Protects the brand fairly without compromising the customer experience

Knows how to flip a tough 
nt into trust

Cares about outcomes and how customers feel, not just closing tickets

Spots process gaps and suggests improvements (SOPs, workflows, tools)

If you only follow scripts, this role is not a fit.

If you lead with judgment and customer care, keep reading.



What You’ll Do

Support customers via Instagram,
, TikTok Shop, and Zendesk 
 + chat)

Provide fast, customized responses (not copy/paste only)

Investigate before replying (order history, tracking, past conversations)

Handle product questions, shipping, refunds, and escalations with clear next steps

Respond to public comments/reviews in a calm, brand-aligned voice

Escalate complex/high-risk cases with strong internal documentation

Follow SOPs while flagging gaps and improvement opportunities



What Success Looks Like

Customers are supported quickly during your shift (target: within 30 minutes)

Tense situations are handled calmly 

Brand trust is protected at all times

Issues are solved with minimal back-and-forth

You proactively improve workflows, not just follow them



Requirements

2+ years e-commerce customer support 
 + chat required)

Experience handling public-facing comments or reviews

Strong written English 

Comfortable with accountability and performance metrics

Reliable internet and ability to work set hours (PST)



Schedule

Remote, long-term role

Set working hours required (share availability in PST)



How to Apply (Required)

Please include ALL items below in one message.



1) Short Video Intro (2–3 minutes)

Please include a Loom or short video covering:

Introduce yourself

Why you believe you’re a strong fit for MyMagicHealer and this role



2) Scenario Assessment

Answer all 5 scenarios below. 

Scenario 1

A customer used Flare Care for 4 days and said it didn’t cure their condition. They demand a full refund.

How do you respond?



Scenario 2

You discover an order never shipped due to an internal error. The customer has been waiting 10 days and is upset.

How do you handle this?



Scenario 3

A customer says another agent promised a refund outside policy, but you see no documentation.

What steps do you take and how do you communicate with the customer?



Scenario 4

A customer broke their Flare Care jar after 3 months. They don’t want to pay and are asking for a replacement.

How do you respond?



Scenario 5

A customer comments publicly:

“This product is a scam. Don’t buy it.”

How do you respond publicly?



3) Practical Details

Internet speed (upload + download)

Available working hours in PST

Expected monthly compensation



We are looking for someone who thinks critically, takes ownership, and wants to help build a world-class Customer Care department.

If that’s you, apply.

title: Vacation Rental Listings Manager
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:



Fieldtrip 
 is a luxury hospitality + real estate firm specializing in the acquisition, development, and management of premium branded short-term rentals. We aspire to be the leading boutique hospitality brand in the luxury short-term rental space, currently operating over $200M in assets, with an additional $50M+ in homes, boutique hotels, and glamping projects in development. Our collection includes the world-famous Invisible House, as well as one of the nation’s largest purpose-built short-term rental portfolios. We own or exclusively manage the assets in our portfolio, selectively partnering with family offices, investment firms, developers, and homeowners who share our vision and seek to be part of our curated collection.



Hospitality is at the core of what we do. Our properties are professionally designed to the Fieldtrip brand standard, allowing us to scale and operate our portfolio like a distributed full-service boutique hotel. At each destination, our professional local teams facilitate a seamless and unique experience for our discerning travelers by ensuring that our homes are in perfect condition and prepared for our guests’ specific needs. Our Experience Curation team, dedicated concierge, and 24/7 Guest Experience team provide prompt support and curate bespoke travel experiences and immersive activities. The quality of our white-glove service is evident in our 3000+ 5-star ratings.



POSITION SUMMARY:



We are looking for a full-time Listings Manager to serve as the expert in ensuring vacation rental properties are effectively marketed across multiple booking channels. This includes creating and managing engaging property listings, integrating the PMS with Online Travel Agencies (OTAs), and ensuring all listings are accurate and up-to-date at all times. This role requires a detail-oriented individual with excellent organizational and communication skills, with experience in revenue management being a plus.



RESPONSIBILITIES:



- Create and Manage Listings: Write compelling and accurate job listings for new vacation rental properties. 

- OTA Integration: Ensure listings on various OTAs (such as Airbnb, VRBO, 
, etc.) are integrated and synchronized with the channel manager.

- Ensure Listing Accuracy: Regularly review and update property listings to ensure accuracy and completeness in the copy, photos, amenities, and other settings.

- Optimize Listings: Use data and feedback to optimize listings for maximum visibility and bookings.

- Coordinate Onboarding Process: Work closely with the operations team to gather necessary information and ensure a smooth onboarding process.

- Quality Assurance: Conduct regular audits of listings to maintain high standards and identify any discrepancies.

- Collaborate with Teams: Work collaboratively with marketing, sales, and guest service teams to ensure consistency and quality across all platforms.

- Monitor Performance: Track and analyze listing performance to make data-driven improvement decisions.



QUALIFICATIONS:



- Must have excellent English skills, both written and verbal.

- Must have the ability to solve technical setup problems through relentless use of resources, tenacity, and attention to detail.

- Must have at least 2 (preferably 3+) years of experience working in the short-term rental (AirBNB) space, ideally in a listings management role, but with guest experience management or remote operations management at a minimum.

- Must have experience working with a US, Canada, Australia, or UK-based employer.

- Must have experience managing processes.

- Must have experience with online travel agency platforms such as AirBnB, VRBO, Marriott HVMI, etc.

- Experience with Streamline, Guesty, or equivalent reservation management system strongly preferred.

- Experience with Microsoft Office, Google Suite, 
, and Slack highly preferred.

- Position is full time (40-45 hours/week).



COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:

Monthly Salary: $900-$1100

Bonus Details: 13th month bonus



Benefits:

- Health insurance

- Paid time off such as PTO, sick days, and vacation days



IMPORTANT: 



Please read the instructions carefully before applying. Please do not apply directly through Online Jobs Philippines. Only applications submitted through our application tracking system will be considered. Apply here: 



This role requires strong attention to detail—and that begins with how you apply. To be considered, all required materials must be submitted in full at the time of application. Incomplete submissions will not be reviewed. If you’re not yet ready to submit all items, we kindly ask that you wait until you are. This ensures fairness and helps us keep the process efficient for everyone.

title: FORECLOSURE SURPLUS FUNDS RECOVERY
description:
Title: Experienced VA for Foreclosure Surplus Funds Start-Up

About Us:

We’re a small but passionate U.S.-based start-up helping homeowners recover their foreclosure surplus funds. Our mission is simple — to reunite people with money that’s rightfully theirs. We’re now looking for an experienced Virtual Assistant who knows this industry inside and out and can help us scale efficiently while keeping our client-focused approach at heart.

Who We’re Looking For:

We want someone who’s been in this field before — someone who understands how surplus recovery works, from researching surplus lists to preparing claim packages. You’ll have plenty of independence, but also direct communication with the founder, making your ideas and input valuable from day one.

What You’ll Be Doing:

 • Research foreclosure or tax sale records to identify surplus opportunities

 • Skip trace and contact owners or heirs with available surplus funds

 • Prepare claim documents, affidavits, and supporting paperwork

 • Manage leads and maintain detailed client records in our CRM

 • Draft and send client correspondence 
s, letters, updates)

 • Help refine our systems to make everything smoother and more efficient

What You Bring:

 • Direct experience in foreclosure surplus recovery (a must)

 • Excellent English skills — clear, professional, and personable

 • Strong research and document organization skills

 • Familiar with Google Workspace, spreadsheets, and online databases

 • Reliable, detail-oriented, and good at managing multiple tasks

 • Comfortable working U.S. hours (EST preferred)

What’s In It For You:

 • Competitive pay with performance-based growth opportunities

 • Work closely with the founder — your role and ideas truly matter

 • Long-term, stable position with room to grow as the business scales

 • Supportive, flexible startup environment that values initiative and trust

How to Apply:

Please include:

 1. Your updated resume (highlighting your experience in the surplus/overage niche)

 2. A short voice or video introduction (optional but appreciated)

 3. A quick note on why you enjoy this line of work and how you can help us grow

title: Customer Experience Professional
description:
Join one of Australia’s Fastest Growing Modern Furniture Brands!



At Life Interiors, we’re passionate about making great design accessible to all. As one Australia’s most rapidly expanding homeware and furniture brand, we’re committed to delivering exceptional experiences for both our customers and our team.



The role



We are seeking a proactive and customer-focused individual to join our team as a Customer Service Representative. This role will emphasize building and maintaining strong, long-term relationships with our customers. The ideal candidate will possess excellent communication skills, a positive attitude, and a passion for ensuring customer satisfaction while fostering loyalty and trust.



What you’ll be doing:



*Customer Relationship Management: Develop and maintain strong, lasting relationships with customers to enhance their

experience with the company. Ensure customers feel valued, heard, and well-supported throughout their journey.

*Issue Resolution: Act as the primary point of contact for customer inquiries, concerns, or issues. Respond promptly and

effectively to ensure customer satisfaction.

*Proactive Outreach: Reach out to existing customers to ensure continued satisfaction, gather feedback, and identify

opportunities for improvements in products or services.

*Customer Retention: Implement strategies and best practices to drive customer retention, resolve complaints effectively,

and maximize overall satisfaction.

*Customer Education: Provide clear and concise information about products or services ensuring customers understand all

offerings and are equipped to make informed decisions.

*Feedback Collection: Collect and analyze customer feedback to identify trends, needs, and areas for improvement,

collaborate with other departments to address concerns.

*Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with sales, marketing, and product teams to ensure customers’ needs are met and that customer feedback is communicated effectively to relevant teams.

*Reporting and Documentation: Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, transactions, and feedback using CRM

tools or customer service platforms.



Great to have:



*Independent and able to work minimal training or supervision, quickly learning new tasks and systems.

*Strong attention to detail, skilled at identifying the root cause of customer issues and resolving them accurately in

accordance with established processes.

*Ability to remain focused, effective, and make sound decisions in challenging situations.

*Demonstrate strong time management skills and be able to handle several customer requests or tasks at the same time

without affecting the quality of service.

*Adaptive, can adjust to new priorities, and use new tools or processes easily.

*Assertive and can confidently provide and receive constructive feedback with management in a clear, direct, and respectful manner, without fear of rejection or conflict.

* We also welcome those who were previously employed by Temple and Webster, Lounge Lovers and other Australian Furniture experience (A huge plus!)







What we are looking for:



*Proven experience in customer service, relationship management, or a similar role.

*Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written).

*Strong interpersonal skills with an ability to build rapport with customers and internal teams.

*Ability to handle difficult or sensitive situations with tact and professionalism.

*Problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively.

*Familiarity with CRM systems and other customer service software is preferred.

*Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

*Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

*High level of empathy and emotional intelligence to relate to customer needs and concerns.



What We Offer:



*Salary offered: TBD depending on experience

*13th month performance based bonus paid in December

*Annual performance and salary review every June

*HMO with an additional dependent

*10 days Vacation leave

*5 days Sick leave

*3 days additional PTO (Christmas day, New Year’s day, & Good Friday)

*Full-time day shift (9:00 am to 6:00 pm - Australian Eastern Daylight Time (AEDT))

*Permanent work from home set-up



Home office requirements:

iCore 3 or it's equivalent with 4GB Ram

Internet speed should at least be at 50mbps



ONLY SHORT-LISTED CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED



For interested applicants, kindly fill out the application form:

title: Technical Site Builder (AI SEO)
description:
About the Role:

We’re hiring a Technical SEO Lead (Strategist–Operator) to own AI-era technical SEO across a WordPress multisite environment.

WordPress Multisite • Indexation • Schema • AI Overview Optimization





This is not a generic SEO role. You will:

-Design entity-first subdomain clusters

-Control indexation (canonical / meta-noindex / robots.txt / sitemaps)

-Shape JSON-LD schema for AI Overviews

-Keep WordPress multisite clean, structured, and fast

-Help operate an LLM toolchain (Claude Code + OpenRouter / Moonshot / Groq) for safe, cost-efficient AI content workflows



If you understand both technical SEO infrastructure and how AI impacts search visibility, this role is for you.



What You’ll Do:

-Architect 4–10 subdomain clusters using entity graphs + interlinking rules

-Implement & audit: Canonical tags, Meta noindex, Robots.txt, XML sitemaps (Google + Bing)

-Add & validate JSON-LD schema: Organization , Service, FAQ, HowTo

-Improve SERP + AI Overview eligibility

-Run Header Cleanup & Trust-Design (no duplicate modules, clean UX)

-Operate & optimize LLM routing: Provider switching , Cost caps , Token limits, Response timing logs

-Build SOPs + QA checklists

-Report weekly: Indexation KPIs , Crawl stats, Coverage changes



Must-Haves:

-Strong hands-on experience with: Canonical tags, Meta noindex, Robots.txt, XML sitemaps

-WordPress multisite experience

-Basic PHP / JS familiarity

-JSON-LD schema implementation (manual or plugin-based)

-Comfortable with LLM tools (any of): Claude Code, OpenRouter, Moonshot/Kimi, Groq

-Clear, concise English communication



Nice-to-Haves

-Bing or Google deindex recovery experience

-Entity clustering + AI Overview optimization knowledge

-Cost & logging discipline (rate limits, token control, latency tracking)



How We Work

Trust-first (no PBNs, no link rings, no paid guest-post farms)

Remote

Full-time (9–5 AEST)

Weekly KPI review

Time Tracker





Compensation

Technical SEO Lead (Strategist–Operator):

?50,000–?60,000/month

Up to ?60,000 for exceptional fit (proven indexation control + recovery + multisite ops)



Before submitting the application, please take the time to complete the test we provided. This will allow you to be invited to an application interview.



Use Subject Line: "I want to be part of the team" - Technical SEO

title: Paid Media Specialist (Part-Time – 4 Hours/Day)
description:
Linc Digital is a performance-driven marketing agency based in Perth, Australia.



We manage SEO, Paid Media, and Web projects for Australian and international clients across construction, home services, professional services, and retail.



We are looking for a part-time Paid Media Specialist to support campaign execution across multiple client accounts, primarily on Google Ads and Meta Ads.



This is not an entry-level role. We are looking for someone with proven, hands-on experience who can manage accounts independently and optimise based on performance data.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



The Role



You will manage day-to-day execution and optimisation of lower-touch paid advertising accounts while working alongside a senior Media Buyer who handles high-touch and large-budget clients.



You must be confident working independently, making optimisation decisions, and escalating risks early.



This is a long-term opportunity for the right person.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Core Responsibilities



- Campaign Management & Optimisation

- Manage Google Ads and Meta Ads campaigns across multiple accounts.

- Monitor daily performance and optimise for CPA, ROAS, CTR, CPC, and conversion rate.

- Structure and execute testing plans (creative, audiences, bidding strategies, placements).

- Identify scaling opportunities and budget adjustments.

- Flag underperforming campaigns early with recommended actions.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Core Responsibilities



- Campaign Management & Optimisation

- Manage Google Ads and Meta Ads campaigns across multiple accounts.

- Monitor daily performance and optimise for CPA, ROAS, CTR, CPC, and conversion rate.

- Structure and execute testing plans (creative, audiences, bidding strategies, placements).

- Identify scaling opportunities and budget adjustments.

- Flag underperforming campaigns early with recommended actions.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Account Setup & Structure



- Build and maintain clean, conversion-focused campaign structures.

- Ensure correct tracking and conversion setup alignment.

- Assist with pixel and tracking troubleshooting where required.

- Maintain naming conventions and internal organisation standards.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Account Setup & Structure



- Build and maintain clean, conversion-focused campaign structures.

- Ensure correct tracking and conversion setup alignment.

- Assist with pixel and tracking troubleshooting where required.

- Maintain naming conventions and internal organisation standards.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Internal Process & Communication



- Maintain strong ClickUp task hygiene:

- Accurate statuses

- Clear optimisation notes

- Time logged daily

- Respond to internal mentions within 1–2 hours during core working hours.

- Escalate issues early when necessary.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Required Experience



- 2–4+ years hands-on Google Ads experience.

- 2–4+ years hands-on Meta Ads experience.

- Proven experience managing multiple ad accounts simultaneously.



Strong understanding of:



- Conversion tracking

- Campaign structure

- Funnel strategy

- Performance metrics

- Experience writing direct-response ad copy.

- Comfortable working with budgets ranging from small to mid-size accounts.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Nice to Have



- Google Ads Certification

- Meta Blueprint Certification

- Experience with Performance Max or YouTube Ads

- Familiarity with GA4 and GTM

- Experience with additional platforms (LinkedIn, TikTok, etc.)



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What This Role Requires



- 4 hours per day (consistent availability required)

- Strong written English

- Reliable internet and workspace

- High attention to detail

- Ability to work without constant direction

- Comfort using ClickUp for all communication and task tracking



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



What Success Looks Like



- Campaigns run smoothly without constant oversight.

- Clear testing roadmap in place across accounts.

- Early identification of performance risks.

- Structured, data-backed optimisation decisions.

- Clean documentation and communication.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This Role Is Not For You If



- You rely heavily on automation without understanding strategy.

- You need daily step-by-step instructions.

- You only have experience boosting posts.

- You struggle managing multiple accounts independently.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Ready to Apply?



Please include:



- Resume

- Brief overview of your Google and Meta experience

- Example campaign results (metrics preferred)

- Platforms and tools you have worked with

- A short 1-minute video explaining why you would be a strong fit

- 2 References 

- We are looking for someone reliable, performance-driven, and interested in a long-term working relationship.

We are looking for is someone that is hard working and detail orientated. We are looking for someone that wants to be a part of our team and grow with our company.

title: Social Community Manager
description:
About Dulcedo



Dulcedo Management began as a high-profile modeling agency and has since evolved into the largest multidisciplinary talent management group in Canada and a leading force in North America. With a steadfast commitment to excellence, our reach extends across all spheres of entertainment, from our offices in Montreal and Toronto to remote collaborations worldwide.



Our talented team of Agents and Account Managers represent and manage the national and international careers of over 500 models, hundreds of Olympic and professional athletes, top-tier digital influencers, content creators, and streamers.



Dulcedo is, above all, a community of incredible individuals who “work hard but play harder.” Our team is united, welcoming, and inclusive, with company culture remaining a top priority. Proudly certified as a Great Place to Work for two consecutive years, our mission is to empower our employees by creating an environment where work feels motivating, creative, and meaningful.



The Opportunity

We’re looking for a strategic, culture-driven, and highly engaged Community Manager to nurture and grow our digital and talent-facing communities. This role is ideal for someone who understands the creator economy, thrives in fast-paced environments, and genuinely loves building meaningful relationships online and offline. You’ll play a key role in strengthening engagement between Dulcedo, our talents, our audiences, and our partners - ensuring our community feels connected, inspired, and aligned with our brand voice.



As Dulcedo continues expanding its international presence, this position offers real opportunity to shape how we cultivate and activate our community at scale.



Scope of Work

Community Engagement & Growth

Build and nurture relationships with our talents, creators, and digital audiences.

Actively engage across social platforms (Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, LinkedIn, etc.), responding to comments, DMs, and community inquiries.

Develop initiatives to increase engagement, loyalty, and brand affinity.

Identify emerging creators, cultural trends, and community opportunities.

Monitor audience sentiment and feedback.

Assist in organizing online and in-person community activations when required.

Track engagement, growth, and community performance metrics.

Analyze trends and provide insights to optimize strategy.

Prepare monthly community reports with actionable recommendations.





Your Profile

+5 years of experience in community management, social media, or influencer marketing.

Strong understanding of social media platforms and digital culture.

Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal) in English

Strong organizational skills: you're a pro at managing tasks & staying on top of priorities.

Excellent time management and a proactive attitude.

Familiar with Canva for simple design tasks like templates and formatting.

Positive, personable, approachable and you enjoy being part of a collaborative team!



Work Parameters & Perks of Working with Dulcedo

Schedule: Full-time

Work hours aligned with Eastern Time Zone

13th month pay to reward your dedication!

Opportunities to grow. As we build our remote team, you’ll have chances to expand your role!

Mentorship & support because we prioritize people, learning, and your success.

A fun, dynamic environment where collaboration and creativity are part of daily life.

Work from home with a full-time schedule synced with the Eastern Time Zone.

Join a close-knit team where your work has real impact and your contributions are valued.

title: Revenue Manager & Analyst – Short-Term Rentals (PriceLabs)
description:
Job Title: Revenue Manager & Analyst – Short-Term Rentals (PriceLabs)

Job Type: Full-Time, Remote

Company: Moxxi

Location: Tasmania, Australia (Remote role based in the Philippines)



About Moxxi:

We manage 180+ short-term rental properties across Tasmania, Australia. Since 2017, we've hosted over thousands of guests and built a reputation for running things properly, with real systems and a team that actually cares.

We're not a giant corporation. We're a tight, high-performing team that takes pride in the work. If you're the kind of person who opens a spreadsheet and feels something, you'll fit right in.



The Role:

We're looking for a Revenue Manager and Analyst to own our pricing strategy across the entire portfolio.

This isn't a set-it-and-forget-it job. You'll be actively monitoring performance, spotting trends, adjusting rates, and making sure every property is priced to perform. You'll work closely with our leadership team and have real input on decisions that move the needle.



This role suits someone who genuinely enjoys the data side of short-term rentals and wants to grow with a business that's serious about doing things well.



NO AGENCIES PLEASE, WE ARE LOOKING TO GROW OUR TEAM.



What You'll Be Doing:



- Managing dynamic pricing across 170+ properties using PriceLabs / KeyData

- Monitoring occupancy, ADR, and RevPAR daily and adjusting strategy accordingly

- Building and maintaining performance dashboards in Google Sheets

- Identifying underperforming properties and presenting clear recommendations

- Tracking market trends, competitor rates, and seasonal demand shifts

- Preparing weekly and monthly owner performance reports

- Working with leadership on pricing strategy for new property onboarding

- Flagging opportunities to improve revenue before they're missed





What We're Looking For, you'll be a great fit if you:



- Have hands-on experience with PriceLabs (this is essential, not preferred)

- Understand STR metrics (occupancy rate, ADR, RevPAR, booking lead time)

- Love Google Sheets and know how to build reports that are actually useful

- Think in data but communicate in plain language

- Take ownership of your work without needing to be chased

- Are genuinely curious about what the numbers are telling you

- Can spot a problem before it becomes one





What You Don't Need:

You don't need to have managed 180 properties before. You don't need a fancy degree. What you do need is real PriceLabs experience, solid analytical skills, and a genuine interest in doing the work well.



Compensation

Salary: $1,000 to $1,300 USD per month, based on experience.

Opportunity for Performance bonuses for the right Tea
mber.



The Details:

- Full-time, remote position

- Australian business hours AEST (flexibility on start/finish time) Monday to Friday.

- Long-term role with room to grow as we expand

- Monthly performance reviews with clear, honest feedback

- A team that values good work and straight communication





How to Apply:

Send us your application with a video: 



- A short intro about yourself and your STR experience (no essay needed, just be real)

- Your experience with PriceLabs specifically

- An example of a report or dashboard you've built (screenshot or description is fine)



Applications without PriceLabs experience or from Agency won't be progressed.

title: VSL Video Editor
description:
Fascial Labs is a fast-growing health supplement brand looking for a hungry, passionate video editor to produce 90-180 second VSL (Video Sales Letter) ads for Meta 
/Instagram) in 9:16 format.



How it works:



We provide the script. You handle voiceover sourcing and all editing. We have an extensive clip library you can pull from, but you're encouraged to find additional footage when it makes the content hit harder.

What we're looking for:



Someone who understands direct response video — pacing, pattern interrupts, text overlays, retention hooks, and how to keep a viewer locked in for 90+ seconds. Experience in health, wellness, or supplement advertising is a plus but not required. What matters most is that you have a sharp eye, care about the craft, and want to get better with every edit.

The opportunity:



This isn't a one-off gig. We test multiple ad angles weekly and can provide as much work as you want. Your schedule is completely flexible — what matters is the output, not when you do it. Pay is per minute of finished VSL content, with significant performance bonuses when your edits drive results. The better you get, the more you earn.



If you're the kind of editor who obsesses over why one cut converts and another doesn't — and you want to grow alongside a brand that's scaling fast — we want to hear from you.
