title: Technical SEO Lead (LLM-Integrated) — WordPress Multisite -  Indexation -  Schema -  AEST
description:
About the role

Own AI-era technical SEO: design entity-first subdomain clusters, control indexation (canonical / meta-noindex / robots), shape JSON-LD schema for AI Overviews, and keep WordPress multisite clean and fast. You’ll also help run an LLM toolchain (Claude Code + Router / OpenRouter / Moonshot / Groq) so teams can prototype content safely and cost-effectively.  



You will:

- Architect 4–10 subdomain clusters with entity graphs and interlink rules  

- Implement and audit canonical, meta-noindex, robots, and sitemaps (Bing + Google)  

- Add and validate schema (Organization, Service, FAQ, HowTo) for SERP and AI-Overview performance  

- Run header cleanup and trust design (no duplicate modules; clean UX)  

- Operate and optimise LLM routing (provider switching, cost caps, response timing logs)  

- Build light SOPs and QA checklists; report weekly indexation KPIs  



Must-haves:

- Hands-on experience with canonical tags, meta-noindex, robots.txt, and sitemaps  

- WordPress multisite management (themes/plugins), with basic PHP and JS familiarity  

- JSON-LD schema implementation (manual or via plugins)  

- Comfortable with LLM tools (any of: Claude Code, OpenRouter, Moonshot/Kimi, Groq)  

- Clear and concise communication skills in English  



Nice-to-haves:

- Bing/Google deindex recovery experience  

- Familiarity with entity clustering and AI Overview content patterns  

- Basic cost/logging discipline (rate limits, max tokens, latency)  



How we work:  

- Trust-first: no PBNs, no link rings, no paid guest-post mills  

- Full-time, 9–5 AEST, remote  

- Daily async stand-up and weekly KPI review  



Compensation:

- Technical SEO Lead (Strategist–Operator): ?100,000–?140,000/month  

- Up to ?150,000 for exceptional fit (proven indexation control + recovery + multisite ops)  

- Senior Implementer (if hired as a pair): ?70,000–?100,000/month  

- Paid practical: ?2,500–?3,500 flat for the 2-hour task  

- Optional performance bump after 60–90 days for sustained KPI wins  



How to apply:

Reply *YES”* and we’ll send you the 2-hour paid practical.  

Or submit the 60-second form:

title: iOS Developer
description:
ReciMe (www.recime.app/)  is a recipe app revolutionizing how cooks organize, plan and shop their recipes. We’re trusted as the digital cookbook by over 500,000 home cooks every week. Our smart importing tool enables users to aggregate all their recipes in one platform within seconds - whether those recipes came from an Instagram video, recipe blog or grandma’s recipe box. We’ve been a Top 10 app 
/us/app/recime-recipes-meal-planner/id
in the US App Store’s Food category for months and were recently featured on The Drew Barrymore Show (
/p/DJINm4OzYxX/). We’re profitable, and growing fast - in the last year, our user base has 10x from 500k to 5M users.



Now, we’re looking for an iOS developer with predominately SwiftUI experience to join our small team!



WHAT YOU'LL DO



- Collaborate directly with our CTO (Nic), co-founder (Christine) and a Product Manager to A/B test ReciMe’s product experience and drive innovative new features

- Design, develop, maintain iOS and iPadOS applications.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.

- Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code.

- Debug and optimise applications for optimal performance.

- Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies.



WHAT YOU BRING



- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related field.

- At least 3 years of experience in iOS development.

- Proficient in Swift and SwiftUI.

- Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automated testing frameworks (e.g. Xcode Cloud).

- Knowledge of software design patterns such as MVC, MVP, and MVVM.

- Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect iOS applications to server-side services.

- Experience with third-party libraries and APIs (e.g. Firebase, AlamoFire etc).

- Experience with Git and agile development methodologies.

- Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

- Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.

- *Bonus: Any prior startup experience or willingness to take on ownership and wear many hats in a startup.*



DETAILS



- Full-time role

- Fully remote, working with a team across the US, Australia, Philippines and Brazil

- Opportunities to travel for team offsites

- Competitive salary



PERKS



- Be part of one of the fastest growing consumer subscription apps

- Work directly with the founders and a small, hungry team solving a real-world problem

- A product with real retention, real revenue, and real impact

- Opportunities to travel for team offsites - this year, we're traveling to Vietnam!



HOW TO APPLY



To apply, please fill out this Google Form 
 



We’re excited to hear from you!

title: Senior SEO Specialist
description:
Make sure you read this in full before applying:



Let me guess... You're the sharpest SEO mind in the room. But you're suffocating.



You're tired of presenting killer audit findings that get buried in a developer's "backlog." You’re tired of keyword-stuffed nonsense, begging for tool budgets, and explaining a 301 redirect to your boss for the tenth time.



This isn't just another job post. This is your exit strategy.



We’re not offering you a new title. We’re offering you a war room, an arsenal, and the targets to prove how good you really are.



Who Are We?

My name is Jim Ng. I built this agency on one principle: get clients tangible results, or get out of the way. 

In just a year, we've delivered for over 50 businesses. Now, we have a clear, audacious mission: to 10x our revenue in the next 12 months.



This isn’t a "hope and pray" strategy. It’s a battle plan. We need elite "Digital Warriors" who don't just "do SEO"—they command the search results.



The Stakes: We Put Our Skin in the Game

We don’t hide behind "SEO takes time" excuses. We offer our clients iron-clad guarantees:



- 10% of targeted keywords on Page 1 in 3 months.

- 30% of targeted keywords on Page 1 in 6 months.

- 60% of targeted keywords on Page 1 in 12 months.



Does this scare you, or does it excite you? If your first thought is "That's impossible," keep scrolling. If your first thought is "With my strategy and AI-driven efficiency, I can crush those numbers," then you’re the sniper we want.



What You’ll Actually Be Doing (The Blueprint)

- Architect of Success: You won't just advise on site structure; you’ll build the SEO Bible for our clients. You have the authority to see changes implemented.

- AI Command & Control: You use AI models not as a crutch, but as an exoskeleton. You engineer complex prompts to automate audits, generate schema at scale, and dismantle competitor strategies piece by piece.

- The Sherlock Holmes of Search: You conduct deep-dive technical, content, and backlink audits. You find the opportunities that Screaming Frog and Ahrefs miss because you know how to look beneath the data.

- Translate Data into Dollars: You live in GA4 and Search Console. You ignore vanity metrics. Your focus is singular: qualified organic traffic that drives business growth.



The Specialist’s Code (Is This You?)

- Growth & Mastery: You have 3+ years in the trenches. You see a Google Update as an opportunity to leapfrog the competition, not a crisis.

- Technical Dominance: You speak "developer." You understand CMS limitations, cloud hosting, and how to work with technical teams to get it right the first time.

- AI Power User: You are well-adept in prompt engineering. You know how to use AI to 10x your own output and accuracy.

- Future Leader: You want to be in a commanding position. You aren't looking for a job to hide in; you're looking for a platform to lead and eventually run your own pod.



The Real Pay-Off

- Unleashed Autonomy: You get the freedom to test, experiment, and implement. This is your domain to master.

- Remote Warfare: This is a 100% remote role. We care about the traffic graph moving up and to the right, not what chair you sit in.

- No Nightmare Clients: We protect our warriors. If a client won't implement your expert recommendations, we fire them.

- Empire Building: You are part of the core team. Your successes will be highly visible and critical to our 10x mission.



Ready to Enlist? Here’s where you can apply:





Nothing else will be entertained.

title: Zoho One Specialist/Tech Ops Specialist
description:
Full-time | Remote | 5PM–1AM PH



We're looking for someone who genuinely enjoys making messy systems make sense.



You'll work alongside a lead to build and maintain clean, scalable Zoho systems for our clients.



Architecture decisions sit with the lead, but this is collaborative. We want your input. If you see a better way to structure something, say it. We're building together.



We build systems that still make sense 12 months from now, not quick fixes that break next quarter.



What You’ll Do



You’ll be hands-on inside Zoho CRM.



That includes:

- Building CRM modules and layouts

- Creating and maintaining workflow rules

- Supporting automation logic

- Creating forms and structured data flows

- Troubleshooting broken processes and identifying root causes

- Documenting clearly

- Learning new Zoho tools as projects evolve



We value builders who think, not just follow instructions. If something feels off, unclear, or unnecessarily complicated - speak up.



What We're Looking For:

You have hands-on Zoho CRM experience.

You can build workflow rules independently.



You're technical enough to tinker. If someone points you to CommandCenter or a new Zoho app, or asks you to create an Excel macro, you won't freeze - you’ll test, read, experiment, and figure it out.



You probably:

Think in systems, not just tasks

Prefer solving the root cause over quick fixes

Document as you go

Stay calm when debugging

Enjoy understanding how backend pieces connect



Bonus if you've worked with:

Zoho Checkout, Creator, Forms

Zapier or Make

Spreadsheet logic (Excel/Google Sheets)

Google Apps Script

Even better if you occasionally say: “Here's what I'd suggest instead.” - We like people who care enough to think!



How We Work:

- We collaborate openly

- We care about mental health and sustainability

- We value ownership without ego

- We solve problems calmly

- We don't expect perfection, but we do expect clarity

- We're serious about good systems

- We're also serious about being decent humans



If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you. Send us your application along with a short 1-2 minute video intro telling us a bit about your experience and how you approach backend problems.

title: Cinematic Video Editor — AI-Native Storytelling
description:
JOB TITLE: Cinematic Video Editor — AI-Native Luxury Storytelling

SALARY: 1100 USD/Month

TYPE: Full-time (40 hours/week)

LOCATION: Remote (Philippines)

SCHEDULE: Async, with Vancouver overlap (PST) for feedback



THE MISSION

Prismiera is a luxury jewelry brand launching a short-form video series — stories about mythology, history, spies, poisoners, queens, alchemists, and beauty told through museum-grade aesthetics. Our shorts should feel cinematic, elegant, hypnotic, visceral, and expensive. (Be prepared to innovate as demands and trends change.)

You will receive scripts, AI tool access, and style references. Your job is to build the scene: generate AI visuals, source archival footage, layer sound design, add voiceover from elevenlabs, and deliver shorts where every second earns the next.

We are hiring for taste, cinematic instinct, and the ability to treat AI generation as a serious production tool.



THE STYLE

Multiple styles as demand and trends change; Dark luxury. Museum. Stylish and lethal. Rich textures. Controlled palette. Both silence and impact used with intention. Every cut has a reason.

Not: default presets, stock photo slideshows.



WHAT YOU'LL DO

Produce vertical shorts (YouTube Shorts / TikTok / Reels) end-to-end using our scripts, style kits, and current channel benchmarks:



Edit: Assemble 30-120s vertical shorts with elegant pacing and restraint. The voiceover leads — visuals serve. You know when to let a line breathe and when to accelerate.

Generate: Create supporting visuals using AI image and video tools (Seedream, Veo, Kling, and whatever launches next). We provide all paid accounts and internal prompting workflows — you bring creative judgment and iteration speed.

Music & Sound: Beat-matching, swells, drops, and silence to drive visual storytelling. You understand rhythm as an editing tool — not decoration.

Product Integration: Place static jewelry photos into moving scenes so they look physically present — masking, light/shadow matching, subtle color grading. Convincing realism, not floating stickers. (AI can handle lot of this, but requires a good eye for it.)

Finish: Minimal kinetic typography + copyright-safe or licensed classical/atmospheric audio (Generated via Suno).

File Hygiene: Clean bin structure, naming conventions. Project files and assets uploaded Notion/
.





CORE REQUIREMENTS



The Eye. You instinctively know the difference between luxury and cheap. Starting out, you'll receive reference videos of our current benchmarks and experimental formats. Your job is to match that standard consistently and innovate on top of them.

Voiceover-First Storytelling. You edit to narration first, music second. You never bury a punchline under a flashy transition.

Retention Instinct. The first frame is an ad for the second frame. You know what stops a scroll. You build hooks visually. Every 2–3 seconds, something changes.

AI Fluency. You're comfortable generating, iterating, and curating AI output across image and video tools. You treat generation as production — prompting, reviewing, selecting, and refining until the output meets the standard.

Adobe Premiere Pro. Required for project handoffs and consistency.

Strong English. Daily async communication — clear, direct, and professional.

Reliable & Coachable. You hit deadlines or warn early. You take direct feedback and iterate fast. You flag problems with options, not excuses.



Bonus (not required, but noticed):

After Effects compositing, Mocha tracking, advanced color grading, sound design beyond music (SFX layering, risers, hits).



VOLUME & DELIVERABLES



Ramp-up (first 2–3 weeks): 2–3 shorts/week as you learn the brand voice and pipeline

Steady state: Push to 4 high quality vertical shorts per week.

Deliverables: 1080×1920 minimum, 30fps, MP4 (H.264)





SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS



RAM: 16GB minimum (32GB preferred) + SSD

Reliable high-speed internet (upload speed matters)

Must run Premiere Pro and browser-based AI tools simultaneously without issue





PAID TRIAL (Shortlisted Candidates)

Before any full-time commitment, we run a paid weekly trial. We provide scripts, elevenlabs access for voiceover, and style references/benchmarks. You deliver 30–50 second shorts. Trial is compensated at $250 USD at the end of each week. If it's a mutual fit after 30 days, we transition to bi-weekly payments of $550 (before work).

This protects both sides — you see whether the work fits your strengths, we see whether the output fits our brand.



WHAT WE OFFER



Paid accounts for all frontier AI tools

Creative identity — you're building the visual language of a brand from launch, not filling someone else's template

Clear briefs — scripts, audio files, mood boards, and reference videos for every batch

Direct feedback — specific, constructive notes on every edit

A brand worth building — Prismiera launches soon, with a second and third AI-native brands after that, which cover a wide variety of content scopes. You're helping build the machine.





OWNERSHIP & CONFIDENTIALITY

All outputs (edits, project files, prompts, generated assets) are Prismiera property and must remain confidential. 



HOW TO APPLY

Important: Use at least 7 Apply Points when applying on OnlineJobs.ph.

Subject line: PRISMIERA EDITOR — [Your Favorite Historical Art Era]

Send only the following (numbered exactly):



Portfolio. Links to your 3 best vertical shorts (mood/atmosphere preferred — not vlogs). Label one that demonstrates music-driven pacing.

The Story Test. Link to ONE short that includes voiceover or spoken dialogue. We need to see that you can pace visuals to a script. (Can overlap with #1.)

Luxury Test (3–5 bullets). How do you make an edit feel "expensive" instead of "cheap"?

AI Experience (1–2 sentences). What is your experience level with generative AI tools? If none, say so — we'll evaluate the rest on its own merits.

Technical (exactly 3 sentences). Describe your approach to compositing a static product photo into a moving scene so it looks physically present.

Specs. PC specs (CPU / GPU / RAM / SSD) + internet upload speed (screenshot preferred).

Integrity (1–2 sentences). Describe a time you missed a deadline or made a mistake — what did you do next?

The Rewrite. Rewrite this sentence in a cinematic tone: "She is really cool and strong and she wins."

title: Meta Ads Specialist (Creative-Led & Results-Driven) - READ DESCRIPTION BEFORE APPLYING!!!
description:
We’re a fast-moving digital agency delivering real results across real estate, construction, e-commerce, and events. No fluff. No cookie-cutter campaigns. Just performance-led marketing that converts. We’re now looking for a high-level Meta Ads Specialist who can run the show—strategy, creative, execution—without hand-holding.

________________________________________

???? What You’ll Be Doing:

• Plan, build, and manage Meta Ads campaigns that generate leads and sales

• Create standout creatives that go beyond standard Canva templates—think engaging Reels, UGC-style videos, scroll-stopping graphics

• Write sharp, conversion-focused copy tailored to each audience

• Continuously optimise and test to achieve the lowest possible CPL and highest ROAS

• Handle full Pixel installation, tracking, and event setup

• Build custom and retargeting audiences across the full funnel

• Integrate with CRMs (via Zapier) and ensure lead flows are smooth and tracked

• Take initiative on what’s working, what’s not, and what needs to be tested next

• Provide clean, actionable reporting weekly (no fluff)

________________________________________

? What We’re Looking For:

• 3+ years hands-on experience managing Meta Ads (with proof of results)

• Strong creative skillset — you can ideate, design, and execute your own visuals and content

• Sharp copywriting skills tailored to different industries and tones

• Advanced knowledge of Meta Business Manager, Ads Manager, Events Manager

• CRM integration experience (Zapier essential)

• Pixel & conversion tracking mastery

• Able to work independently and bring solutions, not problems

• A forward-thinker who’s proactive, not reactive

• Bonus if you’ve worked with real estate, fitness, or service-based clients

________________________________________

???? We’re Not Looking For:

• Someone who waits to be told what to do

• Someone who only copies competitor ads

• Someone who can't interpret data and adjust accordingly

________________________________________

To Apply:

Send us:

• A quick intro

• Examples of your best performing ads (and results)

• Sample creatives or a portfolio

• Your rates and availability

title: Backend Specialist
description:
Full-time | Remote | 5PM–1AM PH



We're looking for someone who genuinely enjoys making messy systems make sense.



You’ll work alongside a lead to build and maintain clean, scalable backend systems (primarily in Zoho) for our clients.



Architecture decisions sit with the lead, but this is collaborative. We want your input. If you see a better way to structure something, say it. We build together.



We design systems that still make sense 12 months from now, not quick fixes that break next quarter.



What You'll Do

- You'll be hands-on building backend systems, primarily in Zoho CRM



That includes:

- Building CRM modules and layouts

- Creating and maintaining workflow rules

- Supporting automation logic

- Creating forms, structured data flows, dashboards

- Troubleshooting broken processes and identifying root causes

- Documenting clearly

- Exploring new tools as projects evolve



We like backend thinkers. If something feels inefficient or unclear, you raise it.



What We're Looking For

- You have hands-on experience building backend systems inside a CRM (HubSpot, Salesforce, Zoho, Pipedrive, etc.). That part is non-negotiable.

- Zoho CRM experience is strongly preferred, but if you've built clean systems in another CRM and can demonstrate strong backend logic, we're open.



You:

- Can build workflow rules independently

- Think in systems, not just tasks

- Prefer root cause over surface fixes

- Document as you go

- Stay calm when debugging

- Understand backend cause-and-effect



If someone points you to CommandCenter, a new Zoho app, or asks you to build an Excel macro - you won’t freeze. You'll test, experiment, and figure it out.



Bonus if you've worked with:



- Zoho Checkout, Creator, Forms

- Zapier or Make

- Spreadsheet logic (Excel / Google Sheets)

- Google Apps Script



Even better if you occasionally say:  “Here’s what I'd suggest instead.” We like people who care enough to think!



How We Work:



- Open collaboration

- Ownership without ego

- Clear communication

- Sustainable pace

- Serious about good systems, serious about being decent humans



If this sounds like your kind of work, send us your application along with a short 1-2 minute video intro. Tell us about a backend system you built and what you'd improve if you rebuilt it today.

title: Social Media Manager and Growth Marketer
description:
True Value Rankings (TVR) is a financial technology platform that provides educational tools and research frameworks for evaluating cryptocurrencies based on measurable fundamentals rather than hype or speculation. We help users understand what drives long-term value in digital assets through transparent scoring methodologies, analytical tools, and in-depth educational content.



We are an independent startup preparing for public launch. We answer to our users, not outside investors, which means every decision is driven by what makes the product better, not what makes a boardroom happy. You can see our pre-launch page at 
.



This is a ground-floor opportunity to shape a product's marketing strategy from day one. If you have ever wanted to build something from scratch rather than maintain what someone else built, keep reading.





THE ROLE



We are looking for a Growth Marketer and Social Media Manager who can help us build a loyal, engaged audience and convert that attention into paying subscribers after our public launch. This is not a "schedule some posts and call it a day" role. We need someone who thinks strategically about funnels, conversions, and audience building, and who can also execute the day-to-day content and community management that makes it all work.



You will be the driving force behind our social media presence across multiple platforms. You will collaborate closely with the TVR team on content creation and platform selection, gradually taking on more ownership as you become familiar with our product and voice.





PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES: GROWTH MARKETING & SOCIAL MEDIA



- Help develop and execute a social media growth strategy across multiple platforms (helping identify which platforms are the best fit for our audience is part of the role)

- Help create, schedule, and publish engaging content that drives traffic to the TVR website (using tools like FeedHive or similar scheduling platforms)

- Help build and grow our audience from zero to a thriving community of people interested in cryptocurrency fundamental analysis

- Help design a content funnel: social media content that brings visitors to the free site, and nurture strategies that convert free users into paying subscribers

- Monitor and respond to comments and engagement across all platforms, filtering out spam and trolls while identifying and nurturing genuine conversations

- Track performance metrics (follower growth, engagement rates, click-throughs, conversions) and report on what is working and what is not

- Create or source visual content (graphics, short videos, infographics) to support posts

- Collaborate with the team on content ideas and contribute to the editorial calendar

- Repurpose long-form content (educational articles, coin analyses) into platform-specific social media content. One article should become multiple posts optimized for each platform's format and audience.

- Help manage
 marketing campaigns and newsletter content through MailerLite





SECONDARY RESPONSIBILITIES: VIRTUAL ASSISTANT TASKS



- Filter and organize social media replies and messages, flagging items that require a team response

- Assist with formatting and uploading content to the website

- Help manage the newsletter subscriber list and
 workflows

- Light research tasks as needed (competitor analysis, content ideas, trending topics in the space)

- General administrative support related to the TVR platform





A NOTE ABOUT THIS ROLE



Our analysis methodology produces results based on measurable fundamentals. Sometimes those results challenge popular opinion within cryptocurrency communities. This means our social media will occasionally attract strong reactions from passionate supporters of specific projects. We see this as an opportunity, not a problem. The right person for this role is someone who can engage professionally with criticism, turn heated 
nts into teaching opportunities, and remain calm and measured when others are not. If you thrive under that kind of challenge, you will love this role.





REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS



- C2 (Advanced/Proficient) English language skills, both written and verbal. This is non-negotiable. You will be writing public-facing content and representing the brand.

- At least 1 year of experience managing social media accounts for a business or brand (not personal accounts). You must be able to provide links to accounts you have managed.

- Demonstrated ability to grow a social media following and drive measurable engagement (provide at least one example with results)

- Strong written communication skills with clean grammar and a professional tone

- Experience creating visual content for social media (graphics, short-form video, infographics)

- Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision

- Comfortable with weekly video calls for strategy discussions

- Comfortable working within detailed brand guidelines and receiving regular feedback on content. We approve all posts before publishing, especially in the early stages, and we need someone who thrives in a collaborative feedback loop rather than resisting it.

- Strong proactive communication skills. In a remote, asynchronous environment, we need someone who flags issues, shares updates, and proposes solutions without being asked.

- Proficient in using AI tools (such as Claude, Gemini, X.ai, Midjourney, or similar) as part of a professional workflow. We are not looking for casual users. We want someone who actively integrates AI into their work to move faster and produce better results.

- Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace for video calls

- Experience with growth marketing, conversion funnels, or
 marketing strategy

- Basic graphic design skills (Canva or similar tools)





PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS (NICE TO HAVE)



- Familiarity with cryptocurrency or fintech (you do not need to be an expert, but genuine curiosity about the space is a strong plus)

- Experience with social media scheduling tools (FeedHive, Buffer, Hootsuite, or similar)

- Experience with
 marketing platforms (MailerLite, Mailchimp, or similar)

- Basic video editing skills (for short-form social content)

- Experience working with startups or early-stage companies

- Experience with Google Analytics or similar web analytics tools (understanding traffic sources, user behavior, and conversion tracking)

- Experience building a social media presence from scratch (growing from zero), not just managing established accounts

- Basic understanding of SEO principles (keyword awareness, meta descriptions, content structure for search visibility)





SCHEDULE, COMPENSATION & LOGISTICS



- Part-time: 20 hours per week (4 hours/day, 5 days/week) with the possibility of increasing to 30-40 hours as the platform grows

- Starting pay rate: $6-10+ USD/hour depending on experience and qualifications, with structured milestone raises tied to measurable platform growth. As the platform succeeds, your compensation grows with it. Full details discussed with shortlisted candidates.

- The first 2 weeks serve as a mutual trial period for both sides to confirm the fit.

- Payment method: Wise

- Flexible schedule: Most work can be done on your own time since posts will be scheduled in advance. We do ask for availability during peak engagement hours when possible, and one weekly video strategy call with the team.

- This is a contractor position with no tax withholding or benefits requirements

- Start date: Late February / Early March 2026





WHY JOIN TVR?



- Ground-floor opportunity: You will shape the marketing strategy from day one, not inherit someone else's playbook

- Growth potential: As the platform scales, so does your role, your hours, and your compensation. We are building this for the long term.

- Creative ownership: We want your ideas and your voice, not just your hands on a keyboard

- Work with a team that values quality over speed, honesty over hype, and substance over noise

- Learn about fintech, data-driven analysis, and the cryptocurrency industry while getting paid to do it





HOW TO APPLY



We read every application carefully. To help us identify serious candidates, please include ALL FOUR of the following in your application:



1. SUBJECT LINE KEYWORD: Include the phrase "Steady Growth" somewhere in the subject line of your application. This tells us you read the entire posting.



2. PORTFOLIO LINKS: Provide links to at least 2 social media accounts you have managed for a business or brand (not your personal accounts). For each one, include a brief note about the results you achieved (follower growth, engagement metrics, or any other relevant numbers).



3. BEST CAMPAIGN: Share a link to one social media campaign or piece of content you are most proud of, with a short explanation (2-3 sentences) of why it worked and what results it produced.



4. WRITTEN RESPONSE: In 3-5 sentences, explain in your own words what "fundamental analysis" means when evaluating an investment. There is no single right answer. We are looking for clear thinking and strong writing, not technical expertise.



Applications that do not include all four items will not be reviewed. We know this takes extra effort, and that is the point. We are looking for someone who pays attention to detail and follows through.





We look forward to hearing from you.



True Value Rankings |

title: Video Editor for some basic work
description:

title: Senior Amazon PPC & Account Manager Full-Time | Long-Term Growth
description:
Senior Amazon PPC & Account Manager

Full-Time | Long-Term Growth

We manage established Amazon brands doing $1M–$5M annually.

We’re hiring a full-time Amazon PPC & Account Manager to take ownership of assigned accounts and drive measurable performance improvements.

Not a beginner role. Not task-only.



Responsibilities

• Manage and scale PPC campaigns

 • Monitor ACOS, TACOS, CVR, CPC, contribution margin, and overall account efficiency

 • Analyze Business Reports and Advertising Reports weekly to identify growth and inefficiencies

 • Review search term data and eliminate wasted spend

 • Improve listings and ranking

 • Monitor inventory and flag stockout risks

 • Send structured weekly performance reports

Independent thinking required.



Requirements

• 3+ years Amazon Seller Central experience

 • Managed $1M+ annual revenue brands

 • Managed $10K+ monthly PPC budgets

 • 3–4 hours daily overlap with U.S. Eastern Time



Compensation

$1,800–$2,800/month

 Full-time. Long-term growth opportunity. Performance-based increases.



To Apply (Required – Read Carefully)

Please include the following in your application:

Largest annual revenue Amazon account you personally managed

 (Include approximate yearly revenue and category.)



Highest monthly PPC budget you directly controlled

 (Include average ACOS during that time.)



One specific improvement you made to an account that significantly impacted growth

 (Explain the situation, what you changed, and the measurable result — include numbers.)

title: Product Owner/Business Analyst (Project Based)
description:
Brisbane Australia based development company C9 - 
 is expanding rapidly and require a Scrum Product Owner or Business Analyst to join the team in a fulltime capacity.



Even if you have applied to other similar positions with us, if you meet the requirements we encourage you to make yourself known again to ensure you are still interested and your circumstances have not changed.



We are looking for a dedicated product owner to be the point person in our software development scrum team.

The Product Owner will be responsible for defining the software product vision and managing the software product development process.



Other responsibilities include supporting the scrum team, managing backlog items, and optimizing the value of the product(s).

You should also be able to lead the product development team toward achieving the vision and mission of the organization.



As a Product Owner, you should have the ability to plan and manage the development project from start to finish, and ensure that the product(s) meet the customers needs.

Ultimately, a top-notch Product Owner will be detail-oriented and have excellent organizational, leadership, and communication skills.



Product Owner Responsibilities:

- Take the lead of scrum teams as the Product Owner

- Providing vision and direction to the Agile development team and stakeholders throughout the project and create requirements

- Ensure that the team always has an adequate amount of prior prepared tasks to work on

- Plan and prioritize product feature backlog and development for the product

- Define product vision, road-map and growth opportunities

- Assess value, write/develop user stories, epics and themes to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value that are aligned with product strategy.

- As needed, do project scoping and write software requirements specification documents and any other documents like wireframes, mockups etc. to aid in understanding the project requirements

- Provide backlog management, iteration planning, and elaboration of the user stories

- Work closely with Product Management to create and maintain a product backlog according to business value

- Lead the planning product release plans and set the expectation for delivery of new functionalities

- Provide an active role in mitigating impediments impacting successful team completion of Release/Sprint Goals

- Research and analyze market, the users, and the roadmap for the product

- Follow competitors and the clients related industry

- Keep abreast with Agile/Scrum best practices and new trends



Product Owner Requirements:

- Bachelors degree in computer science, information technology, or a relevant field preferred.

- Previous working experience as a product owner.

- In-depth knowledge of Agile methodologies.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

- Strong communication skills, written and verbal.

- Strong presentation skills.

- Ability to multi-task and work under pressure.





If you believe you have the right skills and attitude to work in our fast paced team working across multiple projects then please submit your CV and cover letter through Online Jobs.





Must be able to work Australian Times(8:45 - 18:00 AEST) and Holidays





A high level of speaking & written English are mandatory to apply.

title: Full-Time Graphic Designer (Meta Ads + Advertorial Landing Pages)
description:
Salary: $500/month

Position: Full-Time (40 hours/week)

Location: Remote

Start: ASAP



We are a fast-growing eCommerce brand looking for a serious, performance-focused Graphic Designer to join our team full time.



This role is for someone who understands that design is not about “looking nice” — it’s about converting attention into revenue.



If you create designs in Canva, this role is NOT for you.



We are hiring someone experienced in Figma, Photoshop, or Affinity who can produce high-quality, direct-response static images for:

• Meta ads

• Landing pages

• Listicles

• Advertorials

• Product feature graphics

• Comparison charts

• Visual hooks





Important – Read Before Applying

This is a FULL-TIME position.



We do NOT accept:

• Freelancers juggling multiple clients

• Agency designers

• Part-timers

• Anyone working other freelance gigs



We are looking for someone committed long term.



If you are currently freelancing for other clients, this is not a fit.





What You’ll Be Responsible For

• Creating static image ads for
 and Instagram

• Designing high-converting advertorial graphics

• Building product feature callouts

• Before and after graphics

• Social proof visualizations

• Image mockups

• Native style ad creatives

• Landing page image sections



You will work directly with our marketing team to execute new creative angles weekly.



Speed and iteration matter.





What We’re Looking For



You must:

• Be experienced in Figma or Photoshop or Affinity

• Understand basic direct response marketing

• Know how to design for performance, not just aesthetics

• Follow structured feedback

• Be detail oriented

• Meet deadlines consistently

• Communicate clearly



Bonus if you:

• Have worked with eCommerce brands before

• Understand Meta ad creative

• Have designed advertorial or listicle pages

• Know how to build image sequences that tell a story





Compensation

• $500/month

• Full-time role

• Long-term position

• Opportunity to grow into Senior Creative Lead role



We promote internally based on performance.





How To Apply (Required Steps)

Send a Google Drive link to your portfolio

– Must include ad creatives

– No Canva portfolios

– We want real Figma or Photoshop or Affinity work



Include the word “Performance” at the top of your application so we know you read this.



Briefly explain:

– Your experience with Meta ad creatives

– Your experience with landing page graphics

– What software you primarily use



--------------------------------------------------



We will review portfolios first.



If selected, you will be invited to complete a test project.



We are building a serious brand and looking for someone who wants to grow with us long term.



If that’s you, apply now.

title: Senior Technical Solar Operations & Product Specialist  (Technical Right Hand — Quality & Product Expertise)
description:
Role Overview  

We are seeking a highly detail-oriented technical specialist to become the technical backbone of our solar operations.



ABOUT US: We are building an exciting solar technology platform to help our clients on their journey to reduce their energy costs. We are small team at present with 2 of our team also from the Philippines, but we plan to grow rapidly and need to build an exciting, passionate team.



This role exists to ensure every project is technically correct, clearly documented, and ready for smooth installation. You will work closely with sales, installers, and customer service to make sure the right products are selected, job packs are accurate, and technical details are never missed.



You will not be responsible for full system design from scratch. Instead, your role is to validate, refine, and optimise proposals created in OpenSolar.



You will play a key role in ensuring technical excellence and freeing up leadership to focus on growth.



???? Core Responsibilities



1?? Technical Job Pack Ownership

- Review and refine job packs before installation.  

- Ensure installers receive clear, detailed, and practical instructions.  

- Identify missing details, risks, or inconsistencies.  

- Improve job pack quality and technical clarity across all projects.  

- Translate sales outcomes into installation-ready technical information.



2?? OpenSolar Proposal Review & Technical Optimisation

Using OpenSolar, you will:

- Review proposals built by the team and ensure technical accuracy.  

- Adjust configurations where needed to align with real-world installation requirements.  

- Validate system sizing, product selection, and compatibility.  

- Ensure pricing and technical recommendations align with customer needs.  

- Work with sales to deliver technically sound solutions quickly.



This role focuses on technical oversight and optimisation rather than full system design.



3?? Product Selection & Technical Expertise

A core part of this role is having an in-depth understanding of solar and battery products, knowing which solution suits which scenario.



Experience with products such as:

- Tesla Powerwall  

- SunGrow  

- GoodWe  

- Selectronic  

- Sigenergy  

- RedEarth  



You should understand:

- Which products suit different customer goals.  

- Compatibility between inverters, batteries, and system layouts.  

- Strengths and limitations of different brands.  

- Practical installation considerations.



4?? Installer Liaison & Technical Assurance

- Act as the technical bridge between office and field teams.  

- Liaise with installers to confirm correct setup and execution.  

- Answer technical questions and remove uncertainty before installation.  

- Help maintain consistent installation standards.



5?? Technical Support & Problem Solving

- Support customer service with technical troubleshooting.  

- Help diagnose and resolve client issues efficiently.  

- Communicate technical information clearly to non-technical people.  

- Ensure customers receive confident and professional technical support.



???? Ideal Candidate

You are someone who:

- Naturally catches details others miss.  

- Understands solar systems beyond software outputs.  

- Knows how to choose the right product for the right scenario.  

- Thinks practically about real-world installs.  

- Enjoys improving systems and reducing mistakes.



???? Required Skills & Experience

- Strong experience using OpenSolar (reviewing and refining proposals).  

- Solid understanding of solar + battery system operation.  

- Deep knowledge of major inverter and battery ecosystems.  

- Experience preparing or reviewing technical documentation/job packs.  

- Ability to communicate effectively with installers and sales teams.  

- Strong troubleshooting mindset.



? Highly Desirable

- Hybrid or off-grid knowledge.  

- Electrification knowledge (EV charging, heat pumps, etc.).  

- Experience improving operational workflows.  

- Field installation or commissioning experience.



???? Success in This Role Looks Like

- Job packs are extremely clear and detailed.  

- Installers are confident and rarely need clarification.  

- Product selections are optimised for each situation.  

- Technical issues are solved quickly.  

- Sales moves faster because technical decisions are validated early.



???? Who Will Thrive In This Role

We are looking for someone who genuinely enjoys technical accuracy and takes pride in getting things right the first time.



You will likely succeed in this role if you:

- Notice details that others miss.  

- Think ahead and prevent problems before they happen.  

- Care about quality and long-term outcomes — not just completing tasks.  

- Enjoy improving systems and making things clearer and smoother.  

- Are comfortable taking ownership rather than waiting for instructions.



This is not a role for someone who wants to simply follow a checklist.  

It is a role for someone who wants to become the trusted technical right hand in a growing solar

title: Motion Graphics Designer
description:
We’re looking for a highly creative motion graphics designer to help bring our tabletop strategy card game to life through sharp, modern visuals.



This is not cartoon work.

This is not generic gaming content.



We’re building a bold, tactical, military-themed strategy brand and need motion that feels:

- Clean

- Intense

- Modern

- Strategic

- High-stakes



You will help create:

- Kickstarter promo animations

- Short social media trailers (15–30 seconds)

- Animated card reveals

- Logo animations

- Tactical UI-style overlays

- Countdown / launch graphics

- High-impact intro sequences

- Possibly light video editing too.



We are aiming for:

- Modern tactical aesthetic

- Sharp typography

- Clean transitions

- Subtle cinematic tension

- Strategic atmosphere



Responsibilities

- Suggest creative animation concepts

- Turn static artwork into dynamic motion

- Create engaging short-form promotional content

- Maintain consistent brand style

- Deliver in formats suitable for Kickstarter, Instagram, TikTok and YouTube



Bonus:

Experience creating ad creatives that convert.

tal décor, signage, personalized gifts, and home products. We sell across Etsy, Shopify, Amazon, TikTok Shop, and eBay. We are expanding rapidly and need a skilled Virtual Assistant to support our Etsy operations.

Salary and Benefits

Performance-based pay increases available



How to Apply

send link to your onlinejobsph profile- we only hire (Filipino based contractors) do not apply if you are based in other countries. 



Resume

Examples of Etsy listings you have optimized

Proof of VELA experience (screenshot or written explanation)

Holiday Schedule

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Executive Assistant



Real Estate Company — Growth-Focused Role



We are seeking a highly organized, proactive Executive Operations & Client Experience Assistant to support a fast-growing real estate business. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys wearing multiple hats, improving systems, and helping a business run smoothly behind the scenes.



This is not a typical assistant position. We are looking for someone who can think strategically, take initiative, and become a key partner in optimizing operations, client experience, and growth. Long term position!



You will work directly with the business owner and play a central role in improving efficiency, managing systems, and ensuring no detail falls through the cracks.



?



Key Responsibilities



Operations & Systems

    •    Maintain and update CRM systems (Follow Up Boss)

    •    Track leads, tasks, and deal progress

    •    Help build and refine Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)

    •    Improve internal workflows and systems

    •    Coordinate transaction timelines and checklists



?



Executive & Client Support

    •    Manage inbox and prioritize communication

    •    Draft professional
s and client messages

    •    Coordinate appointments, showings, and meetings

    •    Prepare documents, forms, and transaction files

    •    Ensure clients receive a smooth, high-level experience while managing deadlines



?



Ideal Candidate

    •    Highly organized and detail-oriented

    •    Strong written and verbal communication skills

    •    Comfortable learning new software and systems quickly

    •    Tech-savvy and resourceful

    •    Process-minded and enjoys building systems

    •    Self-starter who takes ownership of tasks

    •    Thrives in fast-paced environments

    •    Professional, reliable, and solution-oriented



?



Preferred (but not required)

    •    Experience in real estate or transaction coordination

    •    Familiarity with CRM systems

    •    Experience creating SOPs or workflows

    •    Basic understanding of contracts or real estate processes



?



Work Hours:

Regular hours are Monday–Friday from 12 PM–8 PM Pacific Time. Limited weekend availability may be needed (about 1–2 hours total), paid at time-and-a-half.



Application Instructions



To apply, please submit your resume and include the title of the last movie you watched in the subject line.

(Attention to detail is very important in this role.)

title: 3D Artist Needed for Realistic Mockups
description:
We’re looking for a skilled 3D artist to turn our completed 2D board game assets into high-quality 3D renders for product listings, Kickstarter visuals and promotional use.



You’ll be creating realistic 3D renders of:

- Game box (front, back, angled shots)

- Card decks (stacked, fanned, in-hand shots)

- Individual cards

- Components laid out on a table

- Lifestyle-style product renders

- Exploded component views



Everything should look premium and production-ready.



We want visuals that:

- Look realistic and physical

- Feel professional and polished

- Elevate perceived product value

- Work for Kickstarter, website and ads



The renders should look like a finished retail product, not a digital mockup template.



What We Provide

- Final 2D artwork files (PSD / AI)

- Card layouts

- Brand colour palette

- Typography



What We Expect

- Realistic lighting and materials

- Accurate box dimensions and proportions

- Clean shadows and reflections

- High-resolution export (print + web ready)

- Consistent brand look



Bonus if you can:

- Create short 3D animations (box rotation, card flip, etc.)

- Create cinematic product shots



To Apply



Please include:

 1. Portfolio link (specifically product renders)

 2. 2–3 examples similar to board games or boxed products

 3. Your software of choice

 4. Estimated cost for:

      - One box render

      - Full component set render

 5. Timeline for delivery



Optional:

Explain how you would approach making a board game look premium in 3D.

title: Engineer - Estimating & Quoting – Water Storage Tank Projects
description:
Remote Estimating & Quoting Assistant – Water Storage Tank Projects



Raven Tanks is seeking a reliable, detail-oriented remote assistant to support our quoting and estimation process for new panel tank projects. You’ll collaborate closely with our sales team to prepare accurate quotes based on client needs, engineering specs, and supplier pricing.



What You’ll Do:

Generate cost estimates using our templates and systems

We’re Looking For:



Excellent English (written and spoken)

Tech-savvy with the ability to pick up quoting/CRM software quickly



Reliable internet and availability during or near AEST business hours

Important:

Do not send a resume. Instead, send a 1–2 minute video explaining your relevant experience and why you’re a good fit for this role. Send the video via WhatsApp to Felix at 
This is a remote position with flexible hours and long-term growth potential for the right candidate. Need to be ready to start right away.

title: Instagram Social Media Manager (Daily, 3–4 Hours/Day) – Posting, Captions, Trends, Retention (Training Provided)
description:
We are hiring a Social Media Manager to handle Instagram accounts daily. This is a long-term role for someone consistent, detail-oriented, and confident in written English.



Time requirement: 3–4 hours per day

Schedule: Every day (consistency is required)

Training: Provided



Responsibilities

 • Manage Instagram accounts day-to-day

 • Post content consistently

 • Write engaging captions that drive attention and retention

 • Research content ideas and trend opportunities

 • Suggest content angles and growth ideas based on what is working now

 • Support fan retention through content planning and consistent posting



Requirements (Must Have)

 • Excellent written English

title: Web Designer - WordPress
description:
We are hiring a fast, reliable web developer who can take website projects from start to finish with minimal supervision. You will receive client intake information, brand assets, and internal guidelines, and you will be responsible for executing the entire build efficiently and on time.



This role is focused on speed, ownership, and consistency. You are welcome to use high-quality templates and existing frameworks to move quickly, as long as the final product is clean, responsive, and aligned with the client’s brand. We are not looking for someone who waits for step-by-step direction. We need someone who takes initiative, stays organized, and keeps projects moving without being chased.



Responsibilities include building responsive websites, structuring pages logically, formatting and refining content, sourcing appropriate stock images when needed, using AI tools to assist with copy generation, applying basic on-page SEO structure, and ensuring proper QA before delivery. You must be comfortable managing deadlines and handling multiple projects without letting tasks slip.



The ideal candidate works quickly, communicates clearly, and follows through. If you require constant reminders or supervision, this role will not be a good fit. We value reliability, responsiveness, and the ability to deliver on time.



Experience with modern website builders or CMS platforms is required. Prior experience completing full website builds independently is strongly preferred.

title: Real Estate Video Editor — Property Tours & Listing Content (Toronto Agency)
description:
About Us



We are a Toronto-based creative production company (TRE Media, a division of Mshati Productions) producing premium real estate content for agents and brokerages across the GTA. We have shot some of the most expensive listings in Toronto and deliver 3-5 properties per week across photo, video, and 360 tours.



We are not a one-person operation. We have a production team, admin/ops staff, and established systems. We need an editor who can slot into our workflow, own their deliverables, and keep pace without being micromanaged.



The Role



You will be our primary video editor. You will receive raw footage via Dropbox, follow a structured brief, and deliver two formats per property:



1. Horizontal video (1-3 min) - cinematic property tour for MLS, YouTube, and agent websites. Smooth pacing, clean color, logical walkthrough flow.

2. Vertical reel (30-60 sec) - high-energy cut for Instagram Reels / TikTok. Music-driven, punchy, scroll-stopping.



Volume is typically 3-5 properties per week. Some weeks are heavier. You will be expected to manage your own queue.



What We Actually Care About



We have worked with editors who wait to be told what to do, who treat "I need music" as a reason to stop, who go silent for days, and who deliver sloppy first cuts hoping we will catch the problems. That is not what we are hiring for.



We need someone who:

- Starts immediately when footage lands - not 2 days later

- Picks music themselves unless told otherwise (you are the editor - have taste)

- Communicates proactively - "Starting now," "First cut ready by tomorrow 2pm," "This property has a lighting issue, here is how I handled it"

- Self-QCs before submitting - check your own work against the standard before sending it for review

- Hits turnaround times - first cut within 24 hours. Final delivery within 48 hours.

- Follows the system - we use 
 for tracking and Dropbox for files. You update your status there.



This is not a casual freelance gig. It is a core production role.



Deliverable Standards (What Done Means)



Every video must pass all 5 before delivery:

1. Flow is logical (walkthrough makes sense - entry to rooms to exterior)

2. Color is clean (natural whites, consistent exposure and white balance)

3. Coverage is sufficient (key rooms shown with establishing + detail angles)

4. Transitions are invisible unless motivated (no gimmick transitions)

5. Pacing supports clarity (not rushed, no disorienting motion)



You are expected to catch these yourself before submitting.



Our Workflow

1. Shooter uploads raw footage to Dropbox and completes an editor brief

2. You receive notification via 
 with the brief

3. You edit both horizontal + reel, export to our specs, upload finals to Dropbox

4. You mark status as Ready for QC in 

5. Ops reviews. Revisions turned around same day.



Software: Adobe Premiere Pro (required). After Effects and DaVinci Resolve are bonuses.



Requirements

- Real estate property tour editing experience - portfolio with RE samples required (no exceptions)

- Advanced Premiere Pro skills

- Computer that can handle 4K 10-bit footage

- Fast stable internet + Dropbox experience for large file transfers

- Strong sense of pacing, color, and music selection

- Can work independently with minimal supervision

- Responsive communication (acknowledge messages within 1 hour during work hours)

- Available for full-time or near full-time hours



Nice to Have

- Motion graphics (text overlays, lower thirds, animations)

- Experience with North American / Western clients

- Color grading beyond basic correction

- Can handle brand/corporate video edits (not just RE)



Compensation

- Per-project pay to start (rate depends on experience - tell us your rate)

- Consistent volume: 3-5 projects/week minimum

- Opportunity to move to monthly retainer once trust is established

- Paid test project for shortlisted candidates



How to Apply



Include ALL of the following or your application will be skipped:

1. Portfolio - 2-3 real estate property tour videos you edited (links, not screenshots)

2. Computer specs - CPU, GPU, RAM, internet speed

3. Your rate - per horizontal video and per reel, in USD

4. Availability - hours per day, days per week, timezone

5. Brief intro - 3-4 sentences max. Why you? What makes you different?

title: Senior Media Buyer (Meta Ads + Google Ads Specialist) — Full Time | Results Driven Role
description:
Senior Media Buyer — Meta Ads & Google Ads (Full Time)



We are currently looking for a highly skilled, experienced full-time Media Buyer to manage:

 • Our internal Meta Ads campaigns (Food Truck Coach)

 • Google Ads lead generation campaigns for our clients



This is a results-driven role where performance and outcomes matter more than activity.



You will be responsible for generating consistent, profitable enquiries through paid advertising and fully owning campaign performance.



Experience and proven results are a MUST.



IMPORTANT REQUIREMENTS

 • Must be a specialist in BOTH Meta Ads AND Google Ads

 • Must have proven lead generation results

 • Must be available full-time Monday–Friday, 9am–5pm AEDT (Australian business hours)

 • Must be responsive during Australian business hours

 • This is a performance and accountability-based role



We are not looking for junior media buyers or general marketers.



Role Overview



You will be responsible for:



1. Meta Ads (Agency Growth – Food Truck Coach)



 • Manage and optimise Meta ad campaigns for our business

 • Generate qualified inbound leads and booked calls

 • Test creatives, hooks, audiences and offers

 • Improve cost per lead and conversion performance

 • Scale campaigns safely once performance is proven

 • Work closely with internal team on funnel and offer optimisation



You fully own Meta performance for the agency.



2. Google Ads (Client Lead Generation)



 • Launch, manage and optimise Google Ads campaigns for clients

 • Build and manage Search campaigns (primary focus)

 • Use Performance Max and Display when appropriate

 • Conduct keyword research and campaign structuring

 • Write and test ad copy

 • Optimise for lead quality and cost efficiency

 • Scale campaigns once targets are achieved

 • Rebuild campaigns when performance drops



You are responsible for ensuring campaigns produce results, not just managing them.



3. Lead Generation Ownership & Performance



 • Deliver consistent enquiry volume

 • Maintain efficient cost per lead

 • Identify conversion bottlenecks

 • Improve lead quality

 • Ensure campaigns remain profitable and scalable



4. Tracking & Technical Accuracy



 • Set up and verify conversion tracking

 • Ensure accurate attribution (forms, calls, booked calls)

 • Troubleshoot tracking issues with internal technical team

 • Ensure campaigns are fully measurable



5. Scaling & Growth



 • Increase ad spend once performance stabilises

 • Scale campaigns safely

 • Identify opportunities to improve results

 • Adjust strategy based on performance data



6. Reporting & Communication



 • Monitor campaigns daily

 • Provide weekly performance reporting

 • Track:

 • Enquiry volume

 • Cost per enquiry

 • Conversion rate

 • Campaign efficiency

 • Communicate professionally with clients via WhatsApp during AEDT hours

 • Collaborate with internal team (web developer, technical team, CSM)



Working Requirements

 • Full-time availability (Monday–Friday)

 • Available 9am–5pm Australian AEDT

 • Able to manage multiple ad accounts simultaneously

 • High attention to detail and accountability

 • Proactive problem-solving mindset



Required Experience

 • Proven results managing Meta Ads AND Google Ads (minimum 2 years full-time experience)

 • Strong lead generation experience

 • Experience with local service businesses or agencies

 • Deep understanding of campaign optimisation

 • Strong conversion tracking knowledge

 • Ability to troubleshoot underperforming campaigns

 • Professional written English



Preferred Experience

 • Agency experience

 • Call-based lead generation funnels

 • Scaling campaigns profitably

 • Experience working with international clients



Performance Expectations



Success will be measured by:

 • Consistent enquiry generation

 • Cost per lead performance

 • Campaign scalability

 • Speed of troubleshooting

 • Client satisfaction

 • Agency lead generation performance



Role Objective



Your objective is to ensure both our agency and our clients receive a consistent, scalable flow of qualified enquiries through Meta Ads and Google Ads while continuously improving performance over time.



Application Instructions (IMPORTANT)



To apply, please send a short Loom video explaining:

 • Your Meta Ads experience

 • Your Google Ads experience

 • Results you have achieved

 • Accounts or industries you’ve managed

 • What you believe you could bring to our business



Please DM your Loom link. 



Applications without a Loom will not be considered.

title: VFX / Visual Impact Editor - Lethal Luxury Short-Form Video
description:
VFX / Visual Impact Editor - Lethal Luxury Short-Form Video



Brand: Prismiera (Luxury Jewelry)

Pay: $1100 USD/month

Type: Full-time, 40 hours/week

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Software: Premiere Pro + After Effects (mandatory)



---



The Mission



Prismiera is a pre-launch luxury jewelry brand launching a short-form video series - 35–50 second stories about mythology, history, spies, poisoners, queens, alchemists, and other on-brand topics posted across TikTok, Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



The aesthetic is History and mythology meets high fashion. The editing energy leans closer to a perfectly-timed After Effects edit / storytelling than a corporate product video. (You have an eye for aesthetics and cinematography)



You will receive a script, a voiceover file, and a mood reference. Your job is to build the scene from nothing: generate AI visuals, voiceovers, source archival footage, layer sound design, and deliver a short where every second earns the next. A visual storyteller. (We provide access to the frontier generation models)



---



The Style



YES: Dark luxury. Museum. AE VFX edit. Stylish/Lethal. Fun. Rich textures. Clean typography. Controlled palette. Both silence and impact used with intention.



NO: CapCut default presets. Anything that looks like a stock photo slideshow or a corporate deck.



You understand that more effects does not necessarily mean better. Every cut has a reason.



---



Core Skills (Non-Negotiables)



Motion Graphics - You can build scenes, transitions, and visual elements from scratch in After Effects - not just cut footage.



Voiceover-First Storytelling - You are editing to a narration primarily, music track second. You know when to let a line breathe and when to accelerate. You never bury the script's punchline under a flashy transition. The voice leads - the visuals serve.



Retention Instinct - You understand that the first frame is an ad for the second frame. You know what stops a scroll. You build hooks visually, not just with text overlays. Every 2–3 seconds, something changes.



Rhythm & Beat-Sync - You can sync cuts, zooms, and effects to music. You understand "the drop." If you've made AMVs, fan/anime edits, or phonk edits, you already have this skill - we want you to apply it with restraint.



AI-Assisted Asset Creation - You are comfortable generating images and short clips using tools like Midjourney or Kling. (We usually move onto new tools as soon as they are released). You treat AI as a production tool, not a novelty. We provide all paid accounts - you bring the creative judgment.



---



Bonus Skills (Not Required, But We'll Notice)



- After Effects compositing - Mocha tracking, light matching (future projects will involve product placement in video scenes)

- Typography sense - fonts that feel intentional, never default

- Color grading - pushing AI output and footage into a consistent palette

- Sound design beyond music - layering SFX on movement, crafting risers and hits



---



Weekly Output



Ramp-up (first 2–3 weeks): 2–3 shorts as you learn the brand voice and pipeline.

Steady state: 4–5 shorts per week at the locked quality standard.



You will work from clear creative briefs with reference scripts, mood boards, and audio clips for most batches.



---



How to Apply



Do not send a generic cover letter.

Use 7 apply points or more when applying.



Subject line: Lethal Editor - [Your name]



Send the following (in this order):



1. The Story Test. Link to ONE short-form video you edited that includes voiceover or spoken dialogue. We need to see that you can pace visuals to a script.



2. The AE Style Test. Link to ONE video that shows your visual rhythm and editing craft - an AMV, fan edit, fashion reel, or anything where the editing itself is the skill. It doesn't need to be "dark" or "luxury." It needs to show us how you think about pacing and impact.



3. AI Experience (1 sentence). What is your experience level with generative AI tools (Midjourney, seedream, Kling, etc.)? If none, say so - we'll evaluate the rest of your application on its own merits.



4. Hardware. Your PC specs: CPU / GPU / RAM. Plus your internet upload speed.



5. Turnaround Estimate. How long does a 30–50 second high-quality short typically take you, start to finish?



6. The Rewrite. Rewrite this sentence to sound dark, powerful, and modern: "She is really cool and strong and she wins."



---



Paid Trial (Shortlisted Candidates)



Before any full-time commitment, we run a weekly paid trial. We provide real scripts and style references. You deliver 30–50 second shorts. Trial is compensated at $250 USD at the end of each week (after work). If it's a mutual fit after 30 days, we transition to $550 USD payments every 2 weeks (before work).



This protects both of us - you see whether the work fits your strengths, we see whether the output fits our brand.



---



What We Offer



- Paid accounts for all frontier AI tools; seedance2.0, seedream5.0, etc.

- Creative identity - you're building the visual identity of a brand from launch, not filling someone else's template

- Clear briefs - most, if not every batch comes with scripts, audio files, mood boards, and specific reference videos

- Direct feedback - specific, constructive notes on every edit.

- A brand worth building - Prismiera launches April 2026. A second AI native game/anime brand after that. You're not joining a machine. You're helping build one.

title: Creative Strategist | Meta Ads
description:
We’re a fast-growing 7-figure DTC brand looking for a full-time Creative Strategist to take full ownership of our ad creative direction.



This is not a “come up with a few ideas” role.



This is a high-output, high-learning, high-ownership role where you’ll drive 15–20 new ad concepts per week and work directly with the founder to scale winning creatives inside a live Meta ad environment.



If you want to grow with a real brand (not just freelance random projects), this is for you.

Turn data + learnings into iteration plans



Analyze winners & losers inside Meta



Build structured creative testing roadmaps

Lead weekly learnings calls (collaborative, not reporting)

Daily ad spend



Structured CBO testing



Rapid feedback loops



Clear KPIs



We test aggressively and iterate fast

Data > opinions



Learnings compound weekly

We review performance together, break down direction, and d

Strong concept hit rate

Faster iteration cycles



Scaling winners



Improving CPA & creative efficiency over time



???? Who This Is For

(20 hrs/week) - Subject to change

Subject line:

title: Part-Time Tiktok / UGC Editor
description:
Editing VA hiring post:



Part-time Capcut / UGC / TikTok Editor with potential for more



Hiring for part-time work for a Capcut / TikTok editor



You will be making TikTok videos using Capcup or the video editing software of your choice.  The editing process is fairly simple and straightforward.  Anyone who is proficient in video editing should have no problem with the basic tasks such as:

Cutting dead space in talking head videos

Adding overlay images on screen in the videos

Minor effects such as dynamic zoom, cropping, etc.

Producing b-roll content from voiceover and footage provided, having the ability to digest what is being said and pair up the audio with corresponding footage



Please review a few examples of my content to ensure you are familiar and comfortable with the editing style:

Basic talking head - here you are mostly editing dead space and piecing clips together, adding minor effects like crop and zoom to make the frames look more dynamic and seamless.





Talking head with overlays - same as before, but adding images provided to you on the screen to support what is being said in the video.







B-roll content - you will be provided a voice over and need to work through the footage to find fitting visuals. A strong understanding of English and social media content is crucial here.





Very basic content - this will take up a majority of your workload and will consist of usually one main video thats about 5-10 minutes long, 1-2 photos that need to be addressed, and maybe a request to add a caption.





You will be working hand in hand with me on an extremely viral social media page and there is room for bonuses if deadlines are met and the content performs well!



Requirements:

Attention to detail

STRONG English

Strong internet connection

Previous experience with Capcut / TikTok / Instagram

Good working with a team

Ability to learn and take constructive feedback

Availability to work 3-4h a day (with potential for more and increased salary)

Able to work 5-6 days per week (can take days off whenever as long as mostly consistent)

Can take payments through Wise, Zelle, Paypal, Cashapp, etc

PH or similar time zone



$300/month + bonuses for 2-3h a day MAX and potential full time work in the future with a salary increase.



To apply, please complete the recreate assignment below so I can see your skills (1h max)



Below is a Google drive with the original files you will need to re-create this reference video:



Reference video: one reference video is in the google drive upper "edited chest" and then here is the link to the other: 



Google drive: 



Please complete the following steps:

Download the files and import into your video editing software

Find the “good” takes of the audio sections and stitch together to complete the voiceover

Find the corresponding footage to match what is being said in the voiceover

Pay close attention to detail in the selection of the clips, the pacing (duration of each scene), cropping, etc.

Message me with a link to the re-created video

title: Airbnb STR Virtual Assistant Manager
description:
We are seeking an experienced Virtual Assistant Manager to join and support our fast-growing short-term rental management company. This role is not only operational but also supervisory, as we currently have a team of 3 VAs. The ideal candidate will take ownership of overseeing the current VA team, assisting them when needed, and ensuring smooth day-to-day operations.



This is a full-time position requiring a 50-hour workweek - 10 hours per day, 5 days per week (Thu-Mon), 11am-9pm PT, but you are required to stand by between 9-11pm in case of urgent cases. The role requires availability for evening, night, and weekend work as operational needs dictate. All tasks must be completed personally. Delegating work to sub-VAs is strictly prohibited.



Team Management

- Supervise, support, and mentor a growing team of 3 Virtual Assistants handling guest communication and daily operations.

- Monitor team performance and ensure standards are met (response rate, resolution quality, guest satisfaction, task completion, etc).

- Conduct regular check-ins, performance reviews, and lead weekly tea
etings.

- Provide coaching, feedback, coverage, 1 on 1 meetings, and ongoing training.



Operational Oversight

- Oversee daily guest communication workflows, ensuring timely and high-quality responses.

- Manage escalation issues and support VAs with complex guest situations.

- Assist with administrative tasks such as but not limited to relistings, updating listings, outreaching for vendors (handyman, cleaners, lawn maintenance, etc), and other tasks.

- Coordinate with maintenance, cleaning, and other vendors as needed.

- Ensure SOPs are followed and updated as needed.

- Conduct daily reports for skip managers.

- Maintain high guest satisfaction and consistency in service delivery.



Operational & Performance Improvements

- Optimize account settings, including PMS workflows, OTA configurations, and third-party integrations.

- Monitor account health, listing performance, and revenue to identify issues and improvement opportunities.

- Track guest messages, reviews, tickets, and tasks to ensure timely follow-up.

- Identify recurring problems and implement process improvements.

- Lead expansion efforts for new OTAs and direct-booking channels.



Scheduling & Resource Management

- Manage VA work schedules to ensure coverage across time zones and peak periods.

- Track attendance, productivity, and workload distribution.

- Assist with onboarding and training of new VAs as the team grows.



Qualifications

- Proven experience with Airbnb, VRBO, Bookings, or other short-term rental platforms.

- Prior experience managing or supervising a VA team is strongly preferred.

- Familiarity with Hostaway and Pricelabs property management software is required.

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

- Strong organizational skills with great attention to detail.

- Ability to problem-solve and handle multiple tasks under pressure.

- Proactive, self-motivated, and able to work independently with minimal supervision.

- Experience working across different time zones is a plus.

- You will be working in US Pacific timezone.



Please make sure you complete all the questions in this form along with your application. We will ONLY consider applicants who complete all the questions.

title: Meta Media Buyer / Ad Account Monitor

hours per day

) Resume

2) examples of your experience with meta ads manager

, LinkedIn messaging, calls).
